title: An average experience for a pricey stay
text: The Hotel is out of the city. The food is just about okay. The menu is very limited and the staff won't put in any efforts to customise the food as per your needs. The  room we stayed in was dated. The hotel is not a palace as the name may suggest so be aware of the fact. 2 Half litre bottles were provided for 2 adults and 1 infant. As the hotel is away from the city be ready to shell out extra for cabs/rikshaws on ola/uber. The hotel has a pool and play area which needs to be maintained.
placeInfo/address: Bannur Road Varuna, Hobli, Mysuru (Mysore) 570011 India

title: Peaceful Getaway with Great Dining at Jal Mahal Resort
text: This is a small, quaint resort on the outskirts of Mysore, far from the bustling city crowd. Very peaceful ambience and cordial staff. It has two restaurants and a coffee shop. We majorly dined at the outdoor restaurant Gazebo, which serves everything from North Indian to Italian dishes. The food is good and service is also commendable. We stayed in a classic room which was very spacious and comfortable with air conditioning and hot water. We had a good time at Jal Mahal Resort.
placeInfo/address: Bannur Road Varuna, Hobli, Mysuru (Mysore) 570011 India

title: Worst experience: Property infested with rats and cockroaches
text:
I visited Jal Mahal Resort with friends for a couple of days and it was the worst experience of my life. The place was so dirty as if it had not been cleaned in a very long time. They first put us in a room which had such a dirty toilet that we had to get our room changed. Then in the new room, we woke up to rat poop all over the floor! When we asked them to clean and shift us to a new room, it took them a good three hours to even clean the room and they did not relocate us to a different room. The next morning we again woke up to rat poop all over our room. When they cleaned our room, they did not even replace our dirty coffee mugs. We kept the mugs outside our room only to find a cigarette stubbed in the coffee mug kept outside our room the next day. This is when they claim to be a smoke free property. 

They refused to give us more than one key card per room despite repeatedly asking for the same and even though they knew we were multiple people staying in a room! They were so uncooperative and rude in each of their interactions that we had to stop engaging with them.

When we went to their outdoor  restaurant to eat at night and it was filled with mosquitoes, we asked them for mosquito coils. They were so stingy that they kept two small sticks of not even an entire coil, the result was that we were bitten by mosquitoes as we were trying to eat food.

The bedsheets and curtains in the rooms were so unclean that all of us woke up to allergies and sore throats. We were sick for most of our trip thanks to this.

We had to complete our entire stay in the property because they forced us to pay the entire amount upfront at the reception while checking in. I guess that makes sense because who would want to continue living in a property which is infested by rats and cockroaches.

I would strictly warn anyone against staying at this property because it is a complete health hazard.
placeInfo/address: Bannur Road Varuna, Hobli, Mysuru (Mysore) 570011 India

title: Substandard service
text: My stay at Jal Mahal Resort was deeply disappointing. Upon waking up, I discovered rat droppings in the room, which is completely unacceptable for any accommodation. Additionally, the housekeeping services were inadequate and did not meet basic standards of cleanliness and efficiency. The behavior of the hotel staff was also troubling, as they were consistently rude and disrespectful throughout our stay. Furthermore, the resort’s policy of demanding full payment on the day of check-in felt unreasonable and added to the overall negative experience. Regrettably, I cannot recommend this resort based on my visit.
placeInfo/address: Bannur Road Varuna, Hobli, Mysuru (Mysore) 570011 India

title: Very Horrid Experience. Will never recommend anyone to this place. Rat poop filled rooms. Literally and Figuratively.

title: WORST NIGHTMARE OF MY LIFE! HARRASMENT FROM STAFF! STAY AWAY FROM THIS SHADY PLACE!
text:
I had gone with my friends and my 2 year old to celebrate my birthday. I made the worst mistake of my life by choosing this place. I entered this place and found uncleaned, algae filled fish tanks and ponds everywhere. I had made 50% payment on booking.com before arrival. But they forced us to make full payment before  we even checked into the rooms. I have travelled across the world and this is the first time that happened. Bad first impression. It only got worse from that point. We had uncleaned toilets in the room we were given. They changed our room after repeated requests and the second room had rat poop! (Photos attached). They had kept 2 towels for 5 people. They refused to provide extra plates, cutlery and glasses. They in fact came to our rooms and threatened that if we didn't return the drink glasses by 10:30 they would charge is by the hour for them! They also gave us only 1 key card per room. I had to return with my 2 year old baby in between an outing and forgot to get the key from my friend's bag. They refused to give me extra key to let me in my room. After multiple requests and complaints, someone used the master key to let me in. No extra key was provided even then. 
I spoke with Arun Kumar the general manager of that place. He said he'd come and handle it it 5 minutes. Never showed up even during checkout. He only came when I threatened to not pay my food bills and harassed me, my child  and my friends with threats of harming us. I had gone to celebrate my 37th birthday with my fellow professor friends in peace (I mentioned the age and profession so you understand that we weren't a notorious,loud bunch). I was honestly scared for our safety - not just hygeine and stay wise, but also physically and emotionally harassed by everyone on the property - especially the GM, and his management team. Please stay away from this place even if they give you a free stay if you value your health and safety. We were forced to stay the whole time because they harassed is to pay the full amount at checkin. Would have run in the opposite direction otherwise.
placeInfo/address: Bannur Road Varuna, Hobli, Mysuru (Mysore) 570011 India

title: Totally unsatisfied with my stay and would not recommend this hotel.
text:
I stayed at this hotel for one day — checked in on the 24th May and checked out on the 25th. The room was untidy, and the toilet didn’t have a lock. There were no dress hangers in the bathroom either.

I also used the swimming pool, but it was not clean. After using it, I developed rashes and skin irritation.

Moreover, the staff’s behaviour was very annoying and irritating.

Overall, I am totally unsatisfied with my stay and would not recommend this hotel.
placeInfo/address: Bannur Road Varuna, Hobli, Mysuru (Mysore) 570011 India

title: Do not go here, its a NO NO NO NO NO from us.
text:
We were staying in the Jacuzzi suite (#302). Below are the few things you might want to take a look at before booking your stay here. 

1. The first thing I always check is bathroom. and when we enter the room looks good but later we realised that the bathroom fittings are worst, everything was just temporary fixed, the clothes hanger is broken, The flush water is leaking and so on...

2. The coffee cups were stained and even after informing the reception it hasn't been changed. The door locks were pathetic. The drawers weren't closing properly. The mini-fridge which was suppose to cool down water/beer was hot enough as it wasn't working. 

3. Every individual will want a locker when they travel. The safe which which was given to was so safe that it never opened. 

4. We then realised that the toiletries weren't changed from the previous guest's use and had to get them changed after informing at reception again... 

5. The sofas were dirty and torn, the outdoor game was more like some random backyard.

6. About the indoor games, the queue tips were missing the and I wonder what kind of people go in there, they have played pool/billiard without informing and the balls are full of marks. 

7. The only good thing is the food service and the food... Special thanks to the restaurant staff (Ms. Ranjitha and Mr. Arjun) who took good care of the food and our lunch/dinner experience there. 

Not worth the price they actually quote us. Luckily, we got an offer from booking.com and hence saved about Rs. 3000 (Guessing it.. And yeah, the pictures or the videos on YouTube might impress. you guys (which happened with us), but that is either paid or it was shot when the resort was opened newly. The hotel management says for any occasion inform them so that we can surprise us, we came here for our 15th wedding anniversary and we are already surprised and disappointed with the service and to add on, they didn't bother to give whatever surprise they wanted to. Glad they could forget else, it would have spoiled our mood more..
placeInfo/address: Bannur Road Varuna, Hobli, Mysuru (Mysore) 570011 India

title: Not so pleasant stay
text: This review is based on my one-day stay at the property. Though I didn’t get to explore all the aspects at length, it was a not-so-pleasant experience. The rooms are nicely spread but it gets over as soon as you enter into it. Extremely small rooms, provided with a small table, which is filled with chargeable-chips/dry-fruits, you have to struggle to even keep your phone/key. Charging the phone is such an affair, as there is no table near the electrical points. There is no towel in the room, imagine!! Tea in the restaurant is pathetic. If you are in look for stopover at Mysore as part of your long trips, it can be considered but in that case you can opt for properties which are close to city centre and at more affordable prices.

title: We Stayed there for 5 days
text:
Our experience fell short of our expectations during our 5-day stay. In the initial 2 days, we encountered a few issues. Firstly, the breakfast was not served hot, which was disappointing. Additionally, when we informed the reception about our preference for an eggless cake to celebrate a birthday, they mistakenly provided us with a cake containing eggs.

Moreover, there was a lack of South Indian dishes on the lunch and dinner menus, which made it less suitable for kids. Furthermore, the swimming pool lacked facilities for children, and the service from the staff was notably slow.

It's important to highlight that this property is more suitable for short one-day weekend stays.

title: Safety is a joke here and is not a concern of the rude staff.
text:
As a frequent traveller I can confidently say that this hotel was the worst by far.The staff are very rude and impolite.
I had booked the room for 3 nights but due to safety issues of the staff opening the room in the middle of the night with the master key, I had to check out the very next morning.
The door doesn't have safety features like a tower bolt,so the ONLY method of locking is by the provided keycard.
When I spoke to the front desk in the morning about this,they blatantly told me that the service boy denied opening the door and wasn't even interested in listening.They very rudely turned their faces as I was talking to them.
Even the amenities they provided were used - the tissue in the bathroom was almost completely over and the coffee sachets were ripped open.

To sum it up I would say this is the worst hotel I have been to with highly rude and untrained staff and it possess SAFETY ISSUES.

Not recommendable at all.
ownerResponse/text:
We regret for the inconvenience caused ,we have updated our standards of staffing ethics we honor each and every word of guests and correct it immediately

We have the best of the Lock system ,Every amenities of a luxury hotel is provided If any error of replacement has not happened we regret for the inconvenience.

We look forward to welcoming you and your guests at our hotels
placeInfo/address: #3615/1 Sayyaji Rao Road Opposite Old RMC, Mysuru (Mysore) 570021 India

title: Not the place it used to be
text:
I had last been at Golden Castle when it was under Treebo more than two years ago, so my reviews will be based on that first experience which was very positive. The hotel has changed (worsened) a lot since then and seems to be running on a shoestring budget. Everything that could go wrong, did on my recent stay. 

We had to change room because the AC wasn't working properly and in the new one, the AC made intermittent noises but we decided to let it pass. Poor staff responsiveness, staff having noisy conversations in the corridor, torn bedsheets (replacement was requested, which were also slightly torn), non-functioning tea kettle (again replacement was requested, which was broken but worked), delayed and limited breakfast, no lunch/dinner because the restaurant was supposedly being "renovated".

If you are a new, first time visitor and are okay with or can manage with such an experience, it's another matter. For us, this was for sure our last stay at the hotel. Can't imagine going back after this, especially the way our fond memories from the last stay have been wiped out.
ownerResponse/text:
Dear Sir,
Thanks for your valuable time and giving us the review. We regret for the inconvenience caused, we have updated our standards of staffing ethics we honour each and every word of guests and correct it immediately.
placeInfo/address: #3615/1 Sayyaji Rao Road Opposite Old RMC, Mysuru (Mysore) 570021 India

title: Dissatisfied Stay Experience.
text:
We stayed in OYO 14139 Golden Castle, Mysuru for 2 Nights. This Hotel is situated in a location, which is easily accessible from Mysore Railway Junction and KSRTC Bus stand. Rooms are well maintained.

But, the services are not upto our expectation. 
1.I booked one room for 2 persons on 08.07.2018 for 2 days from 24.07.2018 to 26.07.2018, with option ‘payment to be made at hotel’. I received a message that “Booking is confirmed and we will call you closer to the check-in date to confirm your arrival time’. But I did not receive any call from OYO till 23.07.2018 Morning. Hence I called OYO Golden Castle and informed my arrival time. I also made the payment thro online banking on 23.07.2018. But OYO did not make any call to me.
2.No towels were provided and only one set of toiletry kit with very small Nourishing soap, Body and Hair shampoo and moisturizer. On request only, they are providing Towels, Toiletries etc., (Image is attached)
3.Next Horrible thing is Food. OYO has committed in their email sent to me that “Buffet Breakfast will be served from 8.00 AM to 10 AM”. (Screenshot is attached). But on 25.07.2018, they provided 2 Medium sized idli, one small vada, Kesari bath in small cup, Upma in a cup and a coffee in small cup. No Buffet – All items were served in a single plate, as under noon meal scheme. On 26.07.2018, they provided set dosa (3 No. dosas with 4 to 5 inches diameter), Tomato Rice bath in a cup and a coffee in small cup. (in a Single Plate). Highlight of this Breakfast was that my wife was served a half cooked broken plastic spoon (top portion) in the Tomato Rice bath. I made a complaint and they committed that they would not serve it in future.
4.Room no.203 was allotted. Noisy split A/c. I made a request on 25.07.2018, to set right the A/c, but, no response. Service quality is poor. 

OYO is not offering facilities free of cost. As we pay, we expect value for money. 
Not very happy with our stay at OYO 14139 Golden Castle, Mysuru (Mysore), Karnataka. 
I will advise everyone to think twice/thrice before booking OYO Golden Castle, Mysuru.
placeInfo/address: #3615/1 Sayyaji Rao Road Opposite Old RMC, Mysuru (Mysore) 570021 India

title: Slightly hidden from sight
text:
This place is just near Lashkar police station.
The entrance is designed in such a way that you might miss it when walking the street.
It's only 20-30mins walk from Mysore Junction train station and 5-10mins walk from the bus station. 30mins walk to Mysore Palace entrance and St Philomena Church but both are on the opposite sites of the hotel.
The hotel provides breakfast but the diner is too basic does not look very clean. It would also be cheaper to have room booking w/o breakfast and you can still go and order breakfast ala carte from the diner. Pay per order of course. 
You can get food at walking distance.
Just next door there a eatery where people eats while standing at the table. Yes, the tables are high and the chairs are normal size. I tried idli and tea here. Cheap price and a big idli. I ordered 2 and couldn't finish the 2nd. If you want decent food where you can sit and enjoy meal, better walk around. The hotel have WiFi but you have to ask, and then they will key in the password in your phone. They don't provide it written on papers.
If you want the room cleaned, pass the key at the reception and tell them so. Or else, your room will be untouched.
The people also can arrange taxi service, tour service, call in the auto (the scooter type vehicle) for you. Of course there will be a mark up.
The room is not exactly sound proof so, basically you can hear everything that happens at the outside walkway as though you're watching it on live TV. For that, I give average. If you're a light sleeper, find a better place.
placeInfo/address: No 69 Ashoka Road, Mysuru (Mysore) 570001 India

title: The best 🏨 in Mysore!

title: असुरक्षित अनुभव – Viceroy Comfort
text:
★☆☆☆☆ असुरक्षित अनुभव – Viceroy Comforts, Mysore की लापरवाह मैनेजमेंट

मेरा Viceroy Comforts, Mysore में ठहरने का अनुभव बेहद निराशाजनक और असुरक्षित रहा। होटल में सुरक्षा की कोई व्यवस्था नहीं थी। एक संदिग्ध व्यक्ति को कमरे के पास घूमते देखा, जब मैंने इसकी सूचना दी, तो स्टाफ ने कोई कार्रवाई नहीं की। न सिक्योरिटी को बुलाया गया, न ही कोई जवाब मिला। मुझे अपने ही कमरे में असुरक्षित महसूस हुआ।

सबसे खराब बात थी होटल प्रबंधन का व्यवहार – वे बेहद रूखे और गैर-जिम्मेदार थे। उन्होंने मेरी शिकायत को गंभीरता से नहीं लिया और ऐसे बर्ताव किया जैसे यह कोई बड़ी बात ही न हो।

मेहमानों की सुरक्षा से खिलवाड़ करना बहुत ही शर्मनाक है। अगर आप एक सुरक्षित, सम्मानजनक और जिम्मेदार सेवा की उम्मीद करते हैं, तो यह होटल बिल्कुल भी न चुनें।

परिवारों और अकेले यात्रियों के लिए कतई अनुशंसित नहीं।
placeInfo/address: 770/5, F-25, Ramanuja Road Annex Rajendra Kalamandhira, Mysuru (Mysore) 570 004 India

title: Very Bad
text:
Very badly maintained hotel.

The room they gave us (212) smelled like mold that even gave me allergy and the wifi signal kept disconnecting. I asked to change to another room. In the next room (202) the wifi signal was better and the mold smell was not strong. But the air conditioning smelled like mold again. We decided to stay in this one thinking that probably all the rooms smelled like that. 

At night I wanted to take a hot shower before going to bed and the hotel didn't have hot water. I called reception and I was told I would have hot water in 10 minutes. After 10 minutes I tried to take my shower, but no hot water again. I called reception again and again after every 10 minutes and every time I was told I would have hot water in 10 minutes. I had to wait around 40 minutes hearing the same excuse. I ended up taking a cold shower. 

In the morning I had another shower hoping this one would be hot. It started hot but after 3 minutes the hot water was over. Cold shower again.

They provide Internet access for only one device. For the second device they charge extra.
So they don't provide BASIC things like hot water but charge you for Internet access.

Very poor hotel, even though they try to impress you with nice decoration at the lobby. 

It is worth paying more for a better hotel that doesn't try to deceive you with nice decoration or with the reception information.
placeInfo/address: 770/5, F-25, Ramanuja Road Annex Rajendra Kalamandhira, Mysuru (Mysore) 570 004 India

title: GOOD PROPERTY BUT DISAPPOINTING SERVICES
text:
I had stayed at Hotel Viceroy Comforts for 3 days from 27th Jul, 2018 to 30th July, 2018.
The receptionists Sinchana and Ranjana were extremely helpful, hospitable and the check-in was done quickly and efficiently. The general area, passages, lift are all maintained very well. Spacious property and the ambience is good. The room allotted was quite spacious and well-done except for a broken glass in the side wall panel. I reported the same to the reception to be inspected as it could cause grievous injury and as a guest I didn’t want to be questioned about this damage at the time of checkout. However, for the 3 days I stayed at the hotel, no one bother to inspect it. Then came a series of disappointments :

1. Did not get hot water supply in the bath. Tried informing the Housekeeping which almost doesn’t exist in this hotel as I experienced in the 3 days of stay. Subsequently, I requested the reception and then the hot water valve was opened wherever it is located.
2. On day 1, I had a problem with the flush knob in the bathroom as it was getting stuck and copious water was flowing in the closet which couldn’t be stopped. I brought it to the notice of housekeeping (through the reception as housekeeping never ever lifted the phone whenever I tried for them in the 3 days of stay). They got it temporarily fixed through a housekeeping staff. However, it again repeated in the evening and enormous water got wasted overnight. I again lodged a complaint on the same. Nothing much happened except providing a temporary fix. Hence I requested for a change of room on the 3rd day which they obliged.
3. Daily cleaning of the room, change of towels - housekeeping was skipped on the first two days and they obliged when I requested for it on the 3rd day.
4. Daily Breakfast has a choice of just two pre-fixed snacks apart from bread & butter. Evening snacks options almost don’t exist. I was told I can order tea or coffee.
5.  No newspaper was provided despite being requested for choice of newspaper the guest would prefer.
6. You have a problem viewing T.V., the housekeeping will bring a T.V. remote and set it right but take away the T.V. remote. You are only provided set-of-box remote. 
7. The most disturbing (dis)comfort was with their WiFi connection. They provide a daily plan token which the guest has to use daily by entering the login and password. Except for couple of hours of WiFi, I could not use the WiFi for the rest of my 3 days of stay as it wouldn’t connect. At the reception, they did try to help me by providing alternative tokens and in fact, they even tried several times int the 3 days getting my mobile connected with the hotel WiFi but couldn’t do so. They expressed that, probably there was a problem with their WiFi Server. In fact, WiFi was one of the main motivation for me to book my stay at this hotel. This was a big let down !!!! 
8. 90% of the staff don't understand any other language other than Kannada - this is true with the house keeping, room service, restaurant and some reception staff. Is this a 3 star hotel in a tourist centre !!!??? 

I believe, going by the pre-requisites of a 3 star category hotel which Hotel Viceroy Comforts is, it leaves a lot to meet with the expectations of its guests and also the necessary provisions and services.
placeInfo/address: 770/5, F-25, Ramanuja Road Annex Rajendra Kalamandhira, Mysuru (Mysore) 570 004 India

title: Good Hotel to stay with Family

title: Nice hotel but poorly maintained
text:
I have booked 2 rooms for two families with kids , both room have problems.

gap of 3-4 inch  in middle of bed how wan couple and children sleep?

When we complaint to reception to fix the problem , she said cant do anything , talk to General manager.. but he nighther did the work..
in hotel dine only fix menu .. no options for kids .. we need to go nearby hotels for food. Pathetic service.. disappointed
placeInfo/address: 770/5, F-25, Ramanuja Road Annex Rajendra Kalamandhira, Mysuru (Mysore) 570 004 India

title: Great hotel but no Service
text:
This is great hotel, rooms were spacious bathroom were clean and maintained, lobby area is good. If you are travelling with joint family then there is interconnected door between rooms.  Hotel is great but need proper maintenance.

Few problems with Hotel which needs immediate attention

1>	Poor room service. I ordered Fresh Lime soda, for which room service took almost 40 mins and reminder call. 
2>	No mineral water in room. Only regular RO purified water was provided.
3>	I found small cockroaches coming out from bathroom. I complaint same to reception twice but no one came. Then I had to use my chappal to deal with them.  (Of course on cockroaches, not on hotel staff)
4>	On 20th Morning suddenly hot water supply stopped that wasted my 30 mins.
5>	Food is cheap but needs improvement.
placeInfo/address: 770/5, F-25, Ramanuja Road Annex Rajendra Kalamandhira, Mysuru (Mysore) 570 004 India

title: Best Location- Average Food- Poor Services
text:
The hotel is located centrally in the city with a quick connectivity to the major tourist sites in the city like The Mysore Palace & Mysore Zoo, Karanji Lake etc.

Checked-in the hotel for a weekend i.e. 14-15th April.
The hotel has a huge parking space with around 42 rooms. I booked a room for 2 people with a 'King Size' Bed.
The room was big enough to accomodate 2 people and their luggage. The room had an attached washroom (not so big in size), an almirah, AC and a flat screen TV.

The foor served was pretty good (South / North Indian food options available) in taste and the cost was also pcocket friendly.
Bar is not availble in the hotel premises, but you can bring in your own booze and can order some food to accompany your drinks. (Green Salad & Chili Paneer are saviour.)

The services offered by the hotel was not so good infact they were poor. The room service time was unexpectidely high and the intercom system was pathetically mis-communicated. The staff was least bothered about the guest's comfort and requirements.

There was free Wi-Fi available in the hotel which didn't work for the complete weekend because of some network provider issue and the mobile network reception was also poor. Hope the internet problem is sorted soon! 

The hotel is a good place to stay with your family & friends and enjoy some good food at the roof-top restaurant. The room services can be inproved for better ratings.
placeInfo/address: 770/5, F-25, Ramanuja Road Annex Rajendra Kalamandhira, Mysuru (Mysore) 570 004 India

title: nice food but rest services poor
text: Hotel is good and centrally situated. Lobby and rooms were just OK. Food served was very nice but services are very poor. No water bottles, no towels and no napkins. On requesting for water bottle, they ask to collect RO water kept at floors.Reception services are also not so good. Enough parking space and name of hotel is also good but there are minimum comforts.
placeInfo/address: 770/5, F-25, Ramanuja Road Annex Rajendra Kalamandhira, Mysuru (Mysore) 570 004 India

title: Nice Hotel to stay for Mysore Trip
text: The Hotel was nice to stay.. The rooms are quite big, is in a great location near to the Mysore Palace & other landmarks, has ample parking space. The rooms were quite spacious at a very reasonable price. However, the service quality was not up to the mark. Even to receive tea or water, we had to call them a couple of times and it still came late. I also told the reception staff about the same at the time of check out as an improvement. I would still like to recommend the hotel
placeInfo/address: 770/5, F-25, Ramanuja Road Annex Rajendra Kalamandhira, Mysuru (Mysore) 570 004 India

title: Budget hotel with minimal facilities
text: This hotel is no doubt a good hotel in terms of room size and parking space. However the basic amenities are not properly available. We were initially told that breakfast will be available at xx time and later we were not even provided a complimentary breakfast. The breakfast cost was ₹200 per person. Our worst experience was the dinner. The hotel menu says that it serves the dinner till 10:30 PM. We reached the top floor restaurant at around 10:05 PM and started seeing menu to order food. The waiter insisted us to take buffet rather than going for A La Carte however we didn't wanted to go for buffet as we didn't like menu. We had ordered soups, Biriyani, etc from A La Carte and the waiter was like, Sir, thik hai, mai try karta hoon isko laneka..Later when the food came, it was horrible, panner chilly was full of oil, Biriyani was not even Biriyani, the rice was cold (more than room temperature), and later we found that, it was the same rice which was leftover in buffet, they tried adding few things, and was served to us. The Fresh Lime Soda was a disaster, even a child can make a better soda than what we were served. We we 8 people and we had occupied 2 tables, both tables were served horrible food. The only thing which was served properly was curd rice as there were only 2-3 ingredients to mix and it was easy for anyone to do it. I think the chef left for the day and there were other people experimenting with food hence the waiter was insisting to go with buffet. It was already 10:45 PM and all restaurants were closed outside for us to have an alternative.
placeInfo/address: 770/5, F-25, Ramanuja Road Annex Rajendra Kalamandhira, Mysuru (Mysore) 570 004 India

title: Average

The room is ok but you can hear everything from your room, even the phone at the reception desk which is ringing from 5:30 in the morning til late ... not good if you need a good night sleep after a big day of exploring. Also, the lady who did our check in at the reception was quite rude and the breakfast are free but very poor ...   Finally, the WiFi situation is shocking. You have to sign in with an Indian phone number, which generates a password for you to use the WiFi for around two hours before having to repeat the process again.  just leave I am not recommending this hotel.

title: Good hotel , good location at a VERY good price!
text:
I was doubtful about the quality of the hotel when I got an AC room for slightly more than thousand rupees  , I couldn't imagine that a good hotel at a walkable distance from the railway station and right in the center of Mysore could be so inexpensive!

But I needn't have worried , the decision to book was a right one and the hotel turned out to be VERY good. Rooms were neat , big enough and with functioning A/C and hot water. Service was very good with the front desk manager offering me a late checkout without making a fuss (like the manager at another Treebo property in the city did). The only drawback was the below average quality of the breakfast. They should improve that. 

In short a very good choice for staying in Mysore.

title: We lost our mobile phone in this hotel
text:
We checked in at night around 09:00 p.m on 27th Jan & checked out at 11:15 a.m next day 28th Jan. 29th Morning we entered hotel restaurant with mobile phone around 10:00 a.m to have complimentary break fast & after half an hour we left restaurant & went to our room 306, packed our baggage & vacated room & left hotel around 11:15 a.m.Just after reaching our relative's place we realized our cell phone is missing. Tried calling that number but it was switched off. Later informed hotel staff & next day technician showed the CCTV footage, I was holding cell phone till entry of restaurant but inside restaurant CCTV is not working itseems so unable to watch further. Gave police compliant later. Now police department is investigating this case.
Kind request to public : Please beware of your belonging in this hotel.

title: A jewel of a hotel in Mysore
text:
Kings Kastle is in the city centre and therefore very close to every tourist attraction, all shops are near, and so are the bus stand and the railway station. You could not find a better location.
You will appreciate in inner courtroom in the hotel, the secluded parking space, the lofty landings, the cosy Reception corner with settees to rest and most of all: the amazing staff, the friendliest people behind the desk, ever so helpful, friendly, efficient, courteous and fun!
Shabaaz Khan was brilliant, on the email before I went, he phoned also and in house; Naveen was there as well, and I can't find a flaw with them. I was very lucky to meet with the Manager as well, who is the brother of the owner. There you go: a family business! I firmly believe that behind this team is good management, customer service is a great quality in this hotel. 
A very similar good service is also given by the housekeeping staff: the rooms are spacious and clean, bathroom has all amenities and hot water 24/7; a kettle is provided, a safe, etc, good fans, the lot!
The Restaurant, Darbar, has excellent food to offer, it is on the third floor. I disagree completely with the customer who said the tables were dusty. They are not new, but clean. Again you will get great service and very tasty food!
As for your sightseeing: the Reception desk will advise you of where to buy the cheapest and best silk, the real sandlewood; they can service you with taxi and guides, if you wish.
For info: you can take the local bus from the bus stand to Chanmudi Hill for 30rps, it runs all the time. May I also suggest the Dance Museum on the way down from the hill, there is a bus stop there and you can hop on the same bus again after your visit. Plenty of auto rickshaws also to be hired in the street for good price. Bargain!
I enjoyed this hotel and when back in Mysore, I will make it my home again.
Thank you to all!
Mariana Amar

title: On a Visit to Mysuru
text: Booked a room thro the OYO App. We were three and the room had one double cot and a single cot. Rooms are small and compact and enough for a budget traveler. Location is in busy area and not far from the Palace and Museum. They have a restaurant in the third floor, but the ambience is not good. So better order for room service, which is free of charge. They have parking facilities for cars - not big - able to accommodate about 6 or 7 vehicles. The desk staff was courteous. I landed up at 01:00 am to a very good reception. Recommended for budget family travellers.

title: Wonderful stay, as always!
text:
Wonderful stay, as always!!!!
I visit Jal Mahal so many times, that I have just lost count. I know the staff by name now. I have never found a  better friendlier, scenic, pet friendly,  family friendly, couple friendly ( pocket friendly too) hotel than this. 
We have visited before with our pets, and this time, with elderly people. Right from the security guard to reception, to the busboy, we felt very welcome. 
I can never forget the fact that the staff went out of their way to give my daughter hot chocolate milk, in the middle of the night because her throat wasn't feeling great.
Ask for Chef Vinod particularly, if you want any specific delicacy.. even if it's for your furry companion!
It's a wonderful hotel, resort, restaurant, homestay, home, everything combined together into one. Special thanks to Mrs. Deepa. 
We will visit you soon!

title: Not good
text:
I stayed there for 3 nights with my husband and two kids in a suite room. Let me point out everything.
 In suite room there was no door for bed room... So wats the use of having living n bed room seperately. This is highly irritating. I have stayed at many resorts and hotels but haven't seen such a worst interior. Everytime we need to change dress should we tell others to go out of the suite room!!!!! Also the wooden floor makes some noise while walking which should be taken care. The bed was not soft n was hard to sleep. 

Next was the bar service... It was really worst that on June 9th when we went to bar, they told us to take drinks in resturant and not in bar. Then why should they have seperately bar n restaurant. The families who were taking food in resturant were uncomfortable on seeing us with drinks there.

 Next comes the pool... Oh my god there was no swimming tube available as i don't know swimming when I asked they told none of the equipment are in good condition. Such a worst reply from them. On June 11th they told pool will be opened at 7.30 in morning. So when my kids went at 7.30 on they told to come at 8 o clock since maintenance work is going on. But again at 8 o clock they told it will take 1 more hour for maintenance work to be completed. Such an irritating response.

Next is TV...i have booked the room well in advance and even after I checked in it took more than 2 hours for them to activate tv channel that too minimum channels only.

Next is food... Breakfast taste was not bad but spread was poor. Also there was a big ant in sambar. On seeing that my kids hesitated to eat. 

Next is staff... They all were polite and friendly. That's a good part in staying there.

Next is spa... Good service.

Ambience is good. That's all. Overall my stay at jal mahal was not pleasant. Will think twice before recommending this resort to my friends.
placeInfo/address: Bannur Road Varuna, Hobli, Mysuru (Mysore) 570011 India

title: Overall good hotel but leakage in monsoon
text:
We stayed here two days after a gap of a week. First we checked in on 13 May late at night. There were some good and bad points here. 

Their restaurant serves good food. We had set menu for breakfast and dinner and both times food was decent. Room service was ok, not very prompt. AC was functional and cooling was proper. 

When we stayed again on 18 May, it rained heavily at night and some of our group members complained about leakage in their rooms at night. So much so that some of them were awake till 1.30 at night trying to wipe their belongings that were drenched. A lot of people were complaining about it in the morning, but people sitting in the reception were unmoved. 

Since we were with a group and traveled in the group bus, I am not able to say anything about proximity to market etc.
placeInfo/address: 770/5, F-25, Ramanuja Road Annex Rajendra Kalamandhira, Mysuru (Mysore) 570 004 India

title: Well located having quite atmosphere.......

title: Excellent hotel with great hospitality
text:
This Hotel impressed us from the moment we entered. We were late to check-in and knew we wouldn't get food anywhere at 4 pm. We called the Hotel en route and requested chef to keep rice dishes aside. He readily agreed and even made kichidi for our toddler. 

The rooms are spacious, well maintained, comfortable beds and clean bathroom.Hotel has huge parking area and ample space for kids to run around.

We were very impressed with the courteous staff and the hospitality, Highly recommended for families. 

It is attached to a kalyaan maantap so there could be noise.
placeInfo/address: 770/5, F-25, Ramanuja Road Annex Rajendra Kalamandhira, Mysuru (Mysore) 570 004 India

title: Average hotel
text:
My stay was from 28 Feb to 1 March, the area it's situated is calm and beautiful, has huge parking space, room size is good ,it's spacious, that's the plus points .
Bed and Lenin's are not clean , a.c performance not good , a lot of sound but no adequate cooling effect, 
Now the worst part : BREAKFAST - FIRST DAY  idli,  upma, toast and cornflakes were served on table , everything was measured and served as if they were serving it's for free 
Next day it was a buffet , the plates which were stacked had generous coating of dust and only change in the Menu was plain uttappa instead of upma every thing was literally ice cold on both occasions, service at the restaurant was worst. The hotel is attached with a huge marriage hall , sometimes it may be disturbing.

title: Descent. Value for money.
text:
Booked this place on treebo and costed us around 1100/- for a night. The stay was only for one day. The location of the hotel is very good. Nearby palace and railway station. And the locality is quite descent and not filthy. 

The hotel has small parking limited for max 8-10 cars. Rest have to park outside. Your car may get stuck if someone else has parked ahead of urs during check out. So be careful and be the last to park. The watchman is very helpful. 

The bed room and wash room were quite clean. Ac and tv functional. Room didn't stink.

Since we reached on Sankrantri, the restaurant for the day was closed in the night and the hotel refused to provide service at restaurant or room service. 

The next morning for the inclusive breakfast only a limited dishes were available. Idli, juice, bread jam butter, etc... no dosa.

Overall comfortable stay for a night.

title: An awesome place where you will be charged for an empty plate.
text:
A well planned resort with vast area of green plants trees, ponds, park and playing area for kids. A nice swimming pool is another attraction. The look is like a palace. Rooms are spacious and comfortable.
The restaurant serves tasty dishes with a special Kannada touch. You will love the lawn restaurant with sipping wines.
The hanging dining table with chair us an innovative idea.
NEGATIVES
1.Front office is non responsive. I've complained about the TV which was not working. I complained four times but no service technicians attended. I couldn't use the TV for the entire period of stay.
2. I asked for two plates from the restaurant for using our fruits purchased from Mysore. They politely told me that each plate will be charged Rs 20 each. My FIRST EVER EXPERIENCE IN A STAR HOTEL.
I don't know the logic.
3. There are two types of staff. One is extremely helpful and supportive especially the north east staff. The other a few are hostile. When I asked for some drinking water on the dining table, he showed me the area where water is kept.
4. Getting a taxi, Ola Uber etc is very difficult. Try to travel with own conveyance 

Still I recommend this beautiful resort for families especially with kids.
ownerResponse/text:
Dear Guest
We thank you for staying with us. We have noted the areas of improving.Will look in to this. 

Regards
General Manager
placeInfo/address: Bannur Road Varuna, Hobli, Mysuru (Mysore) 570011 India

title: Very Disappointing and highly inorganized
text:
The Resort as such is very nice and clean, but the team there are highly uncompetitive to handle crowd. The day I landed, there was a marriage happening and obvious was crowded. As result I was not given a parking, while the booking mentioned as parking included. Hairdryer not available as standard, but requested one was not usable, the rooms are clean, but had broken wash room accessories, blocked sink and most important of all absolutely no flexibility in breakfast timings. when I requested for a late breakfast, the reply was a blunt "NO". 
To reach out to a manager to talk about the discomfort, it was 30 mins wait for me at the reception. I could not also cancel, as it was a advance payment at the time of booking. I finally decided to checkout changing the plan to another alternate location. 

Since I am a frequent traveler, I am generally used to hotels and resorts with better hospitality and flexibility. This was not the fact at this place. Hence a very poor rating for my side.
ownerResponse/text:
Dear Guest
Greetings from Jalmahal resort
At the outset our sincere regret for not meeting your expectations. We have taken note all the observations you have made and taken corrective measures.We had updated the normal breakfast timings to you and never said no. As you wanted have breakfast post your temple visit, we honored that and you had the breakfast from buffet.

once again our apologies for the inconveniences 

regards
General manager
placeInfo/address: Bannur Road Varuna, Hobli, Mysuru (Mysore) 570011 India

title: My experience in the hotel
text:
Nice place for stay and very delicious breakfast.

You might be wondering why did I give 2 star even though it's nice place for stay with awesome breakfast?

Here is the answer:
We had selected executive room with breakfast for myself, wife and small kid. As we were travelling via Mysure, we wanted to spend night there and take some rest. We reached hotel around 10:30 at night. We slept and next day morning, we were checking out after breakfast. They send a person to check the room and the person came saying Kettle is not working. However, we didn't get time to even plug in the kettle to check that is working fine or not. I conveyed same and they checked with their management. They concluded that it might be by someone else and we were not charged extra. But, it was very embarrassing situation for us. When I shared this experience with one of my friend, he mentioned that same thing happened with him before 2-3 years.
ownerResponse/text:
Thank you for feedback. We have noted your feedbacks. Have briefed our team to be little more sensitive while dealing this kind of instances. FYI, the tea maker in your room had a burnt smell upon checking. We regret for the inconveniences caused.
Regards
For Jalmahal resort
General manager
placeInfo/address: Bannur Road Varuna, Hobli, Mysuru (Mysore) 570011 India

title: Decent value for money place
text:
We spent the new years eve at Jal Mahal resort. The property is small but is the outdoors are neat.  The outdoor restaurant is awesome and the food is good. 
Since we went on the new years eve, we expected some delays in the service but the hotel staff was professional and tried their best to take care of the customers. But that is one area of improvement for the Jal Mahal team.

Also the rooms are not so clean and specially the bathrooms can be much better.
Overall a nice resort with Value for money services , good staff, nice outdoors but below average rooms and scope of improvement in the dining services
ownerResponse/text:

placeInfo/address: Bannur Road Varuna, Hobli, Mysuru (Mysore) 570011 India

title: Pathetic jal Mahal palace
text:
This hotel was recommended as top best stay at Mysore. As so we booked the hotel. Though the facility at the resort is good, but following are the main draw backs and why I wouldn't recommend 
1. Even after the booking room at this restaurant. The management don't have a courtesy to call us and confirm the booking and arrival. We need to call multiple times.
2. I request for simple candles for the dinner as we are newly married couples. There was not response from the management. 
3. Outdoor dinning was available but they didn't even mentioned in arrival and showed us the path to highest noisy indoor dinner hall with no cultured guests and staff who are busy in there own billing business.
4. After dinner was ordered. It arrived after 45-50 min and first only ordered food we brought without any serving plates and we kept requesting them, then no spoons, then we requested for sauce and salad was just a dream.
5. None of them served the food. They just kept the food on the table for the dogs to feed.
6. Besides, I observed that the plates kept outside the door upon room service we lying there from the day of check in to check out.
7. While booking it was offered that there would be free parking. But initially parking inside the resort was denied and then provided later in some corner without any dedicated parking space.
8. Towels and bedsheet we old and not replaced.
9. Only single quantity of shampoo and soap for a couple was offered for a couple and with no hand wash in the washroom. I wonder what nonsense is this.
10. Non of the staff in the dinning area speak kannada and give us the option to talk in Hindi or English only.
11. Morning breakfast complementary, but worst than night dinner. All food were prepared early morning and served cold and donuts were hard as stones. 
12. Dinning tables we not cleaning regularly and dish plates were not cleaned properly.
13. They neither provided tissue paper for cleaning the plates too.

Trip advisor plz visit the place anonymously and recommend the guests.
ownerResponse/text:
Dear Mr.Arjun
Thanks for sharing your feedback. We highly regret for the inconveniences caused to you. We have looked into the case, and found that there was a delay in restaurant service due to the long holiday rush and indoor restaurant was the only place available for dining. The outdoor restaurant was full to offer you with guests waiting. From the tone of your comments, it looks like you are more keen on a personal attack than being honest in your feedback. FYI, calling our other guests uncultured, make us doubt on your culture. Please note we cater family crowd with kids and can't be operating as silent zone. Why you expect someone to speak in kannada , when you can converse in english. FYI we have employees who can speak multiple languages. We don't take any special arrangements in our common dining on a long weekends and holidays. Any special requests are entertained only on weekdays and with advance booking, at extra cost. We operate a resort and not provision stores to stock candles. The plates are cleared and left in the corridor from departure rooms to be picked up later. Parking is ample and on first come first serve basis. We expect you to be well versed with how resort /hotel operates as we don't call any one if it is a prepaid/ guaranteed booking. Our plates are cleaned and wiped, so no need of wiping the plates again. On your other observations we found everything fine and nothing average.

We wish both of you a happy married fruitful life ahead. You are always welcome as our guest and I am sure you will definitely have a change of opinion

Regards
For Jalmahal resort
General Manager
placeInfo/address: Bannur Road Varuna, Hobli, Mysuru (Mysore) 570011 India

title: Pathetic place to be called as Resort/Hotel
text:
Damn pathetic hotel. Please be alert.. It's not a pet friendly hotel. 
No covid protocol has been followed
What made me to write this.
1. They were not accepting Agoda booking, mentioning they have stopped working with Agoda. Earlier it turned out they are working actively.
2. I booked a room with 3occupancy as per the option available on Agoda, during check-in hotel declined the booking that we don't accommodate 3people in a room. And forcing us to upgrade the room with additional 2.5k cost.
3. Room service is is a disgrace. They charge you glass, and extra Utensils 🤣
4. Front desk is full with arrogant people. Even their so called GM. GM was trying to be an old uncle, was asking about my relationship with occupants. I mean seriously.
5. Restaurant will charge if you taking your food outside sitting. Inside the restaurant they are completely mess.
ownerResponse/text:
Dear Mr.Rajat

Greetings from Jalmahal

We have looked in to the matter. We want to put this on record so that the other people on this platform can know the truth.We had made it very clear when you called that executive room can't take 3 adults and a pet. The hotel was sold out and we could give you an alternative as there was an early check out. Even you can check now, We don't sell base category rooms on Agoda. Still we were trying to help you by contacting Agoda in the late evening. The resort has every right to safeguard its image and verify the authenticity of its customers and that too when 2 men and a lady wants to share a room. We are not here to check your relationship status and least interested in that. You were threatening us with your high contacts of knowing the district SP and show us what you are. We are very particular about the guest id proof's and its a internal policy not to entertain the above configured occupancy to share the single room. This is not limited to Jalmahal only and a standard protocol followed everywhere.

Calling the GM as a uncle itself shows your wrong attitude, arrogance and lack of maturity. You must familiarize with the hotel practices and get accustomed with basic guidelines.

The breakfast is not charged extra to you. But you want to feed your dog with 4-6 eggs from the buffet counter free of cost is definitely a no to us.

We wish you could be a little more polite and professional in your approach. Our guest's are our bread and butter, but one can't expect the hotel staff to be their glorified slaves.

Regards

For Jalmahal resort

General Manager
placeInfo/address: Bannur Road Varuna, Hobli, Mysuru (Mysore) 570011 India

title: Relaxing holiday with our pet
text:
Jal Mahal is a great place to visit with family, friends, and pets. Yes, pets!!!! Though we selected this resort mainly because it was pet friendly, we realised that this decision was the best ever made. Jal Mahal is a beautiful property, with amazing food and hospitality. We stayed at the Jacuzzi Suite, and wow! What a great experience it was!! Chef Vinod is great, so is Anjum Ma'am... And the General Manager. Yes .. within two nights of staying at this place, we were able know these dedicated people, who run the place very well. We weren't really worried about the lack of use of the swimming pool or other activities ( due to strict COVID protocols that the resort has to follow as mandated), we really didn't miss any of these much. Our entire family was happy, including our pet ( who was treated really well) and none of us missed these things.
Food was amazing, so was the ambience. 
This is one of the best pet friendly resorts you can visit. One of the best resorts even otherwise. They have a specially curated menu for pets! Yes!!
It may not be the biggest resort ever, but the best place for a relaxing holiday ( with or without pets) . But if you do have a pet, this is ONE property, you HAVE to  visit!!!!!
ownerResponse/text:
Dear Ms. Sushma
Greetings from Jalmahal Resort,Mysore
Indeed all honor was ours to serve you and your family. Your positive comments definitely boost our team to serve our guests in a better way. My special thanks to you for the warmth you people had shown with our team.

We look forward to your visit again. Take care. Stay safe, stay healthy

For Jalmahal Resort ,Mysore
General Manager

 From your booking , you had booked a classic room thru OTA @ a price of just Rs. 3750 inclusive of breakfast and taxes for 2 which is the most economical and best deal. title: Decent & Budget Hotel
text:
This is was my second trip to Mysore, it was pleasant stay in Hotel Viceroy Comfort. I was with my wife and 2 & ½ years daughter. 

Hotel & Room:
Hotel staff was helpful and without any special request been made during the booking, receptionist allowed up for early check-in. Room was neat and clean.

Food:
Hotel do have a restaurant, but I felt it was not fully equipped kitchen, as they have only option of buffet dinner and no “a la carte menu”. In buffet, they served only vegetarian food and no non-vegetarian option is available. In break-fast as well they have limited menu, which is good at some time.

Overall I would say it is a decent, average, budget hotel, near to Mysore Zoo and Mysore Palace, easily accessible and easily to find.

Hope you guys will find this review helpful...
Happy travelling and enjoy your trip...
ownerResponse/text: Dear Sir, Thank you so much for your kind feedback after your recent stay in our Hotel The Viceroy Comforts We are very happy that you enjoyed your days in Mysore and hope to have you with us soon again.
placeInfo/address: 770/5, F-25, Ramanuja Road Annex Rajendra Kalamandhira, Mysuru (Mysore) 570 004 India

title: Not as expected .....!!
text:
We stayed for only one night in this hotel during Dussera time & I would say, it is just a place where you stay overnight whenever you are travelling to your next location. Even for this, there are A LOT of better places to stay in Mysore ! Considering the sheer timing & high demand for hotels during holiday season, I had no other option to my budget except to choose this hotel.
Pros: > Location of the hotel is an advantage. near to the city center.
> Ample parking space (it is just inside the same compound of a marriage hall)
> Relatively spacious rooms
Cons: > The working staff are not professional & are very rude
> For the quality of the room, it is highly overpriced ! 
> The quality of the bed linen was pathetic & was re-used from the previous guest stay !!! I had to call the house keeping (which they did not pick up)& had to call multiple times to request for replacing it !
> Food is not that great 
> Check-in was not smooth & we were made to wait for more than 45 mins for the room to be ready from the previous checkout. Unfortunately after our travel with kids, we were made to wait for long !
> Bad odor inside rooms, & the wall adjacent to the AC had seepage due to dampness
> TV was not working & we didn't even try to contact anybody knowing the response would delayed !  
> When Wifi login was requested to the from office, they asked to come back to the reception area to get the credentials !! The expectation was as compared to other hotels, they have to make sure they give out the login & PW during the time of check-in. May be trying to save some bandwidth / usage ughh... !!

Overall, not at all a favorite place to stay, & if you go by my suggestion, please look at a better option with much cheaper pricing.
placeInfo/address: 770/5, F-25, Ramanuja Road Annex Rajendra Kalamandhira, Mysuru (Mysore) 570 004 India

title: Very nice hotel for family stay
text:
First of all I would like to thank you all guys for your review. Based on your review only, I selected this hotel and it was a very nice one to stay with Family.

I will narrate from how I reached there. Please note that guys from outstation, get some auto/taxi and tell them that MG Road, next to JSS Hospital,Rajendra kalyana mandapa.(initially I struggled to get this proper address and when returning from Palace I recalled the places nearby and explained to Auto drivers which make hassle free to me to reach here). Please note that this is annexed with that Marriage hall. As soon I entered, the receptionist gave me a warm welcome with smile and she is very polite and excellent in explaining all the things(nearby places  and hotels) and how to reach there and telling the Auto fare as well. I went with my family and room was very neat and clean.

From there the palace is at walkable distance(later I come to know that straight road leads to palace J), but since I am with family and not clear about the routes, I took auto and reached there in 5 minutes.

In the Roof top, they have a hotel attached, but it was costly and nearby we can get one hotel and it is reasonable and good in taste. Even though I tried once in their roof top restaurant, I ordered noodles, even-tough it is good in taste, they poured lot of oil which could be a mistake but later I did not tried there, so I do not want to make wrong suggestion on this.

I stayed there for one day, the next day morning is Ganesh Chaturthi, so I planned to go for a temple, they were very much interested in guiding me to the temple which is having 101 idols of Ganesha. Later I went to Siva temple, which is opposite to the hotel and it was very nice experience. Also when I check out, some guy from hotel got an auto and the receptionist debated with the auto driver and later he agreed for 80 rupees for a drop to junction. Near to Mysore Junction we can find a hotel named as Adyar Anandha Bhavan, a VEG restaurant, which is good in taste but little costlier.

So overall my experience is very good in the hotel. I can recommend who ever plan for a good stay with family can choose this.
ownerResponse/text: Dear Sir, Thank you so much for your kind feedback after your recent stay in our Hotel The Viceroy Comforts We are very happy that you enjoyed your days in Mysore and hope to have you with us soon again.

title: Nice Family Hotel
text: Hotel is situated closer to all attractions. I always try to avoid using my car for sight seeing. Firstly, it is difficult to find the routes in a new location. Second thing is the safety of car parked in a public place. This hotel has huge parking space with 24 hour security. We checked in closer to 2 PM, left the car at hotel and managed all the visits by auto rickshaws. Auto rickshaw drivers at Mysore are very friendly and fare is low. Hotel room was big and well maintained. View from the room was horrible (All you can see is wall of next building). But  we didn't care much as we will be there only to take rest after all the visits. Overall service was good. Didn't try lunch and dinner at the restaurant. The complementary break fast was very good. My family enjoyed the stay.  The viceroy Comforts will be our first preference for the next Mysore Visit.

the room was decent enough for the price, and the washrooms clean.

we could not check the restaurant in hotel.

if you are heading towards any farther destination and want to use mysore as a stopover for a nights rest, this hotel is good enough due to its good location and budget pricing.

the hotel has parking which is a plus point considering the location of hotel

title: Please be aware when you select king kastle
text:
Dear Readers

when you plan for a trip to mysore please book your rooms in advance and make the confirmation message from the hotel through mail or message.

I was traveled to mysore on 23 Sat 2015, and i already booked my rooms in kings Kastle in advance , i was booked 2 four bed family room Rs 3000/- each including tax ,i insisted them to provide their account number to transfer the amount ,but person who is responsible for the bookings told me ,your room is already booked so you dont need to transfer the amount, then i said ok to the guy ,but they didnt give any confirmation message to me. when i reached there hotel they told me ,i booked 2 three bedroom room for 3500 including tax. At the time of booking the rate for 4 bed room shown in trip advisor is 3200(offer price) but when i contact directly they told me Rs 3000/-.They are actuly cheeting me by saying the amount ,they told me their person is booked the room correctly and it was my mistake and also told me they will not give four bed room Rs 3000/- it will be minimum of Rs 3700 including tax.
They ask me to show the booking message for 4 bed room but i did'nt get the message , they told me they will send SMS for every booking , if they send SMS for every booking i will get the message for three bed room, but i didnt get any SMS 
when i asked that they told me there room is not available. 
The actul thing is they are barganing the rate with me ,fist time he told me 4 bed room is not available then i told them i dont want your room then after some time they told me they will give the room but not for the rate Rs3000/-.They clearly know i was travelling with my family and i will give the whatever the amount ,but i didnt stay there and i took other hotel .

title: Just don't waste your money
text:
I stayed in this hotel this week (until yesterday) and writing this review immediately so that others can avoid wasting their money. I booked the double room for for holiday stay and went the my wife. A simple double room in Mysore during this off season time costed about 2000 per day. Hotel and room looked good in pictures but very ordinary in reality. Simple summaries are as below.
: Room are small and simple four walled. Just a double cot and few wood work. 
: Coffee, tea water in room are rationed to exact number.
:Bath room does not have any thing but a soap, bucket and mug. Even basic amenities like dental kit/shaving kit not provided.
:News papers are not provided even when asked.
:Car parking space is poor.
: Vegetarian restaurant attached had very tasteless preparation. Complimentary breakfast is poor quality.
: Only saving grace is soft-spoken employees. But it won't compensate other short coming.
Think before hurrying to book by seeing in net. Such rooms should not cost more than ₹1200.

title: Good Covid Break
text:
The review is based on Covid situation
Room: Booked a Classic double room. The room is spacious and clean.
Amenities: Apart from Children Play area nothing is open. There might be amenities but due to the Covid restrictions nothing is operational.
Service: They denied to carry my bag giving reason of Covid when I insisted they agreed to carry the big bag as I had a two year old baby.
Food: Hardly any options. Food is not good and very expensive. Spent 3.5K on two days food.

It is such a good place but it can be much better with some attention to these details

title: Great place to spend with family!
text:
We were two families with an 8 months old kid & stayed at this place for two days. Our initial choice was to go for executive rooms. But, we chose to switch to Classic ones while booking with MMT (thanks to Google/MMT reviews! Executive rooms are pretty small and only good if your are looking for a quick night stay). Resort premises with a lot of greenery offer fun time for kids and a refreshing break for adults. There were good number of indoor/outdoor activities which we couldn't explore much with our baby. Breakfast was sumptuous and filling. Staffs were very friendly (thanks to the lady staffs at restaurant, chef at live counter, room boy and reception staffs). Swimming pool was clean and very well maintained. Place is very family friendly and most of the guests we came across were families with kids. Guests are given a parting gift at the time of checkout containing couple of water bottles and snacks, a gesture very well appreciated.

Suggestions:
> Classic rooms in the ground floor doesn't have sitouts/balconies. We didn't know about it until we did check-in and we wish we were given rooms in first or second floor.
> Parking space is not good enough to accommodate a full booking day. So, if booking is for a long weekend, I would recommend to get early to the resort if you don't fancy having your car lying by the road. (Security staff did help us get a space to squeeze in our car when resort MD left, thanks to him)
> Carry swimming costumes. Pool staff is pretty strict about the rules. Worst case, you can get swimming clothes for rent.
> Ola/Uber services don't have coverage in the area of resort. So, you may want to sort out the outing plan accordingly.

Only con we came across:
> Resort premise is open for smoking. But, with so many kids around, I believe resort authority should contain the smoking to some smoking room or something. I wouldn't want my baby exposed to smoke while roaming around the premises. There is a pub area available, which may be dedicated for smoking as well.

Had a wonderful weekend! Would definitely prefer this place for another vacation!

text:
I Rakesh Jatiana MD Elitez Tours And Travel Services  organised a group reunion of 60 People who joined from all parts of India. Booked in Jal Mahal Resort and Spa in Mysore, Karnatka from 16 Nov to 18 Nov 2019.

It was a fantastic experience with Jal Mahal Resort & spa, their staff, Managers specially Mr. Arthur looked after our group for 2 days. Well behaved, well mannered they were very helpful and fulfilled all our demands as and when required by any member of our group.

Apart from this front desk staff was very well behaved and helpful.  Housekeeping was to our satisfaction

Cheff and all galley staff and service people were very good and the best food was served all the days with varieties with good taste and best service.

All group members were so happy and I feel proud to organise this trip with Jal Mahal Resort & spa Mysore.

I recommend this Hotel to all visitors planning to visit Mysore. 

My heartly congratulations and Thank to all Staff of Jal Mahal Resort. especially Thanx to dear Arthur and his Staff.

Though the rooms was well layed out and cosy, space was a premium. 
The toilets were clean, though there were some spots in the bathe areas.

Food quality was strictly average. 
The  worst part is the location of the room. The room was just next to the reception and there was a lot of noise.  Even after telling them that we are getting disturbed, there was no reduction in the noise levels. And this noise was done by the hotel staff! !

Would still rate them higher than kaveri palace though.

title: Unseriöse Mitarbeiter
text:
Die Reception bedient ebenfalls ein Touristic & Booking office, jedoch nur zu eigenen Gunsten. Wir wollten ein Zugbillet nach Udupi kaufen. Uns wurde mitgeteilt, dass es keinen direkten Zug gibt, wir sollen mit dem Bus reisen. Dies wollten wir nicht. Uns wurde danach mitgeteilt dass es einen Zug mit Umsteigen gibt aber nicht in den nächsten 4 Tagen, sei alles ausgebucht. Dies konnten wir fast nicht glauben und sind zum Busbahnhof gefahren. Und prompt, es gab einen Direktzug und zudem hatte es noch genügend freie Plätze. Uns wollte man einfach ein Busticket (möglicherweise von einem Freund von ihnen) verkaufen und so Provision kassieren.

Zweiter grob mangelhafter Vorfall: wir fragten in der Reception nach was ein Tuk Tuk in ein von uns gewünschtem Restaurant kostet. Er teilte ins mit 200 Rupee für ca. 4km. Der Mindestpreis liege bei 50 Rupee. Wie wir dann erfahren haben kostet diese Strecke maximal 80 Rupee und der Mindestpreis liegt bei 30 Rupee. Es stehen auch vor dem Hotel zahlreiche Personen und Tuk Tuk rum, die einen immer gröber über den Tisch ziehen wollen. Unserer Meinung nach glauben alle dort, dass weisse Reisenden viel Geld haben müssen.

Für uns kommt dieses Unseriöse Hotel nie mehr in Frage, wir sind sehr entäuscht!

title: Disappointed
text:
No pick up or drop service provided, although committed in the hotel booking voucher.
The room provided for 3 persons, was of inadequate size and after placing the 3rd bed, movement inside the room became restricted. For the extra bed a blanket was provided but neither a cover nor a bottom sheet for the blanket was provided. We had to literally pray, cajole and finally fight for the cover.
A major safety issue is the positioning of the electric kettle inside the closed wooden cupboard. A major accident is just waiting to happen.
For payment against our extra days' stay the hotel initially refused to give any invoice and a proper receipt. They also insisted that, they would be accepting only cash payment. After a long heated discussion they provided me with a MMT statement of accounts signed and stamped by them, accompanied with a snide remark that this was the first time for them when a PAX has asked for a signed and stamped acknowledgement of payment.
Overall a sad experience.
P.S. The Restaurant offered a meager menu. But food was good and well prepared. However, they also insisted on cash payment for food served at Restaurant. 
Overall standard of cleanliness of rooms was good.

title: Small hotel with a big heart
text: We had a pleasant stay at Treebo Golden Castle for a couple of days. I was a little underwhelmed at the sight of it when we arrived, but the rooms were quite all right. The staff is warm and friendly and willing to go the extra mile to make your stay comfortable. As a budget hotel, I would rate it average on the price-value equation - but the location weighs in as you have quick and easy access to downtown Mysore and the touristy spots as well. They have parking space in the basement and just outside the hotel (which is where I parked my car - the security guard sits right there). The breakfast, frankly, is not great - with very limited variety. But the North Indian food we ordered (this is a veg only place - please note) for dinner was quite decent. Speak to the room service folks and they'll probably get you non-vegetarian food from a couple of places close by - although they officially maintain that food from other places is not allowed! Rooms are clean - except for some stains/spots on the wall tiles in the bath. I think they should follow a more stringent cleaning routine for the bathrooms. Go for it if you're there for a day or two and don't plan to spend too much time at the hotel.

title: Excellent and Marvellous Hotel to Stay in Mysore with Neat Ambience!
text:
I had booked this hotel all of sudden on Saturday early morning itself and was not sure about how the hotel would be and I was assured very much that the room will be reserved and I should really say that this was one of the best and neat and hygienic hotel in Mysore. After entering the hotel lobby I was mesmerised by the ambience and neat and hygienic surroundings. The reception staff was very friendly and received us with smiling face and took all our details within few minutes and handover the room keys to the boys.

Soon we went to our rooms allotted  in the 3rd floor and as soon as the room was opened I was surprised to see the kind of luxury kind of room within the budget cost it has got all the modern amenities i.e. starting from unlocking the door too switching on/off lights automatically. Hot water was available 24/7 both in the wash basin as well as in the shower too.

Regarding the room service boys or service they are one of the best and always smiling people who will take your request and explain you very much with patience and I liked their friendly atmosphere without expecting anything from return.

Overall my complete family including the kids enjoyed the stay here and I should once again say that this is seriously one of the best hotel to consider if you are planning for budget neat hotel.

title: Great location and good food, let down by pathetic customer service
text: I booked 3 rooms (did 3 separate bookings to take advantage of makemytrip's 50% discount coupon) for 6 adults and 2 kids (4 yr and 1 yr) for one night. Received confirmation emails from mmt for 3 rooms. The idea was to arrive there late evening and sleep to explore Mysore next day. We reached the hotel around 9pm after a great day at Shravanabelgola. Mr. Murali (if I recall the name correctly) was at the reception who broke the bad news that the hotel had only one room as they received only one request for one room from mmt. Usually I call the hotels/resorts in advance to ensure they have received the booking from mmt (mmt has great offers at times but their sense of customer service is absolutely pathetic and it became evident during this episode) but this time I couldn't do so as it was last minute plan. It wasn't Mr. Murali's fault but his lack of sensitivity to our situation (3 families with 2 young kids stranded at 9pm), his poor communication, his lack of command on what was happening around...it all left me baffled. He obviously had to deal with my wrath as I was already pissed off with what makemytrip did. This was mads worse by the fact that the entire hotel was sold out. Mr. Murali told us that his two other properties (viceroy and the president) were also sold out for that eventful night. Since we all were very tired and drained, we (8 of us) decided to settle in that one room and dine. We ordered food, it was great so no complaints there. We asked for 3 extra mattresses as the room was quite big (thankfully) and I wasn't sure what mmt would do to help me out at that hour. We were in for a surprise as there was no hot water supply in the room (we all wanted to take shower). When I called the reception, I was told that they stop it at 9pm. I lost it at this point and walked down to reception where Mr. Murali was present with his sorry again. As soon as I raised my voice, he said, "sir, I would switch on the supply". Isn't it amazing that he refused on phone, made me come down all the way to yell at him to start hot water supply? He could have just told the same to me on phone. Around 10:30pm, I called mmt customer care and blasted at the representative. I guess that wasn't really my night so l ran into a representative who had no sense of customer service. He uttered the formal nonsense he was probably trained to utter, without any sincerity in his tone. He told me that he would call the hotel and find out what went wrong. He did that and spoke with Mr. Murali in front of me. You can imagine what would have been the outcome when two people with no sense of customer service spoke to each other to help a customer out....bang on. The mmt's representative simply offered to cancel the two bookings (that was so nice of him to do that, right?) and made it clear to me that he couldn't do anything else to help 3 families with 2 kids who were left stranded in night by mmt. He said that mmt wouldn't pay for the cost of extra mattresses (so what if because of us eight of you had to sleep in one room, we are makemytrip...we can do anything we want and people would still come to us...I agree with that though). Finally I realized that it wasn't going anywhere and it was my fault (even if to make peace with myself) that I didn't call the hotel to ensure that mmt has passed the booking to them, which I always do. So I went back to THE room and crashed in the last remaining corner. Next day, I raised the issue (not of mmt's pathetic customer service but of Mr. Murali's apathy) with the GM who was a patient gentleman (he had to right). He heard me and apologized. I told him that they need to find someone else for reception as Mr. Murali wasn't even fit for room service, and there he was...the acting in charge of hotel in night. At least 3 other patrons yelled at him in front of me (tv wasn't on, ac wasn't working, etc.). The room was neat and large, food was good, the location is great...the good things. But the place is run like a pg with a warden who is more of a dictator. I hope it changes. But until then, big thumbs down to Mr. Viceroy as there is no Comfort here.
placeInfo/address: 770/5, F-25, Ramanuja Road Annex Rajendra Kalamandhira, Mysuru (Mysore) 570 004 India

title: Decent Stay
text: My stay in a Premier Double Room at Viceroy Comforts with my wife and kid was quite decent. Checking in procedures were very simple and all the staff were extremely cordial. Room is very spacious and clean. The entire premises is kept neatly. Bathroom is a bit small but neat. The vast parking area is another commendable aspect. The location might seem to be a bit hard to find out for strangers but once you get there you will realize that it is right at the heart of the city and besides, the property can be easily located with the help of Google Maps. Major tourist destinations such as the Palace and zoo are so close to the hotel that it takes hardly a five minutes drive. Mall of Mysore also is near. They have a rooftop restaurant which serves only north Indian dishes. Food is a little overpriced and not so tasty. This would not be a problem as there are a couple of good vegetarian restaurants nearby. However, the view of the Chamundi Hills from the rooftop restaurant is superb. In a nutshell, Viceroy Comforts is  value for money and a place where you can surely spend your leisure hours with out any tensions.

text: Wer nur etwas zum Schlafen sucht, wird hier zufrieden sein. Das Hotel liegt gescheit zum Palast (1,8 km) und man kann auch zur Philomenia Church zu Fuß gehen. Zu Essen schräg gegenüber ein muslimisches Restaurant mit Tandoori-Ofen auf der Straße. Prima. Leider funktioniert sonst in diesem Hotel fast nichts auf Anhieb. Zimmerschlüssel. Internet (extrem mühsame Prozedur), Frühstück. Es gibt nur indisches Frühstück, kein Toast, keine Früchte, keine Cornflakes. Am nächsten Tag haben wir es uns selbst organisiert. Es hat dann immerhin 45 Minuten gedauert, bis es Kaffee gab. Leider keine kalte Milch (die war komplett warm gemacht). Vom Hotelmananager wurden wir immer wieder hingehalten.
