title: Good place for a relaxing vacation
text: Jal Mahal resort is 8kms away from main town of Mysore and is located in a nice and quiet location. Very ideal for folks who are interested in morning walks. This makes it an apt place for a sit back and relax kind of a short vacation. The rooms are neat and the staff are courteous. It has plenty of open space and greenery with some nice palace-type architecture. This also gives all the selfie and photo obessed folks a plenty of options. The area for outdoor games is good but the indoor play area needs adequate lighting and also a staff who can help you with the equipments. Now, the most important part - Restaurant, the vegetarian is pretty good but non-vegetarian is a disappointment. The breakfast buffet was pretty decent but the ala carte for lunch was an average affair.

title: Not worth calling a resort. Strictly not recommended.
text: Restrooms and rooms were too small and unclean. None of the facilities were usable during our stay since they closed down all indoor games, cycling etc due to lack of staff. Rooms were too noisy since they play loud music for bonfire dinner just outside the room and create nuisance till midnight. Even after asking them to turn down the volume, I could not sleep the whole night. Everything is too costly. Just to rent a bicycle was 50/hour (That too limited time only till 5:30 PM). Most of their facilities dont operate after 5:30 PM (Cycling, Cricket, Indoor games, Swimming pool, etc). So basically you cannot do anything in the evening. Distance is far away from the city. Palace, Brindavan garden or any nearby restaurant is atleast 10-35 kilometers away. If you book for triple occupancy also they provide complimentary breakfast vouchers for only 2 people. Worst hotel experience in my whole life so far.

text: Stayed there for two nights with wife & kid. Good property. Nice ambience. Near to the Mysore Palace and Zoo. Staffs are friendly and willing to help out. The rooms are big and good.The food is okay. Comfortable stay.
placeInfo/address: 770/5, F-25, Ramanuja Road Annex Rajendra Kalamandhira, Mysuru (Mysore) 570 004 India

title: Terrible service
text: First shown to a dirty room, unmade beds, dirty dishes, asked to be given another room.  This had no hot water or toilet roll.  Bed linen frayed, towels had rips in them.  When I complained in person at reception, they really couldn't have cared less.  Hotel is a business boutique hotel.  Breakfast in dining room was good, but again service dreadful.  We had a room on second floor at the front.  This hotel has a function room next to it and the 2 days we were ther there was a wedding being held which started with the band rehearsing at 6am and finished about 1am both nights.  Consequently room we had was very noisy.  I would not recommend this hotel.
placeInfo/address: 770/5, F-25, Ramanuja Road Annex Rajendra Kalamandhira, Mysuru (Mysore) 570 004 India

title: Not to be fooled by its look!
text:
Stayed here 2 nights, rooms booked by my travel agent. The only good thing that i can recall about this hotel is the cozy lobby and nothing else. Upon arriving checked with the receptionist on the temple timing but the information was wrong. 
We occupied 2 rooms and both were not clean, something the management need to look into. Only 2 very flat pillows provided and only 1 extra given upon request, for which the staff expected for tips (minutes upon arrival). Had issues with the hot water supply, you have to call them a few times and basically wait and wait, end up bathing in cold water.
Feeling hungry after checking in at about 3 pm, we went to their restaurant to be told there is only tea and bajji. The next morning breakfast was not ready on time despite confirming few times on their breakfast timing the day before, not even coffee or tea was ready. After waiting for half an hour, we came down to the lobby, lodged a complaint and then left with empty stomach as we had our list of places to visit.
We came back in the evening again just to find the rooms were not cleaned. Decided to leave this place as early as possible in the morning, we requested for a wake up call at 4 am but received nothing. We got ready to leave at 6 am and all the staff's were still sleeping in the lobby, only 1 of them bothered to wake up (now you know what happen to our wake up call)
Oh! There is Wi-fi connection, but you have to sit in their lobby.
placeInfo/address: 770/5, F-25, Ramanuja Road Annex Rajendra Kalamandhira, Mysuru (Mysore) 570 004 India

title: Quiet Stay
text: Nice place, quite location, enjoyed the stay for a day.The breakfast was not that great but the food served for lunch and dinner was very tasty. Had a good walk inside the Hotel compound as it's spacious.
placeInfo/address: 770/5, F-25, Ramanuja Road Annex Rajendra Kalamandhira, Mysuru (Mysore) 570 004 India

title: Nice place
text: Nice place and well located. Most of the attractions are quite close by. The rooms are cosy and the service is good. Could have made the bathroom a little bit more dry by separating the wet area. Another hotel with the same name adds to the confusion and guests need to keep that in mind.
placeInfo/address: 770/5, F-25, Ramanuja Road Annex Rajendra Kalamandhira, Mysuru (Mysore) 570 004 India

title: OK, decent enough. Service and breakfast needs to be improved.
text:
Overall a decent stay. Breakfast quality and menu needs lot of improvement. Breakfast is included in the room charges itself, but not up to the expectation. The menu list on breakfast buffet is less and quality is low. The pooris and noodles were oily and not served hot as well. Chutney is ok. Also the quantity kept is also less. There was no top up of the items, but the service people were waiting for us to finish fast so that they could clear the utensils fast. 
On the lunch and dinner menu, only chinese and north indian dishes are present. There was not South/North meals available. i.e., no simple items present on the menu(not even idli's), which are suitbale for kids. Rooms are of good quality, but could have been better for the price paid.(It was an AC deluxe room). Hot water in bathroom should be asked, otherwise they do not worry about switching ON the geyser. Only after calling the reception it was switched ON.
placeInfo/address: 770/5, F-25, Ramanuja Road Annex Rajendra Kalamandhira, Mysuru (Mysore) 570 004 India

title: Its very good.

title: Good location, Too much noise, Bad AC
text:

title: Comfortable Stay, Great Location
text: We - my wife & I - stayed for one night on 2nd October 2014. We had some difficulty in locating the Hotel due to poor directions given. The staff is friendly and well mannered. It's certainly value for money. We ordered dinner in the room itself. The service was a mixed bag. Certain small items we asked took a long time but the dinner was served too quickly ! The breakfast however was a sad affair.

title: Nice and Comfortable
text:
We visited there during Dussera and trust me it was very difficult to get accommodation during that time. Coming to our stay, it was nice and comfortable, just what we need during a packed tour like ours. This hotel might not offer you best in class luxury but neither it disappoints you. Will try to summarize 

Positives:
Clean and Hygienic
Quick room service
Located very near to Palace and other tourist attractions
Ample parking place
Reasonable Tariff

Negatives:
Very limited breakfast buffet (tasty though)
No Fans so at times AC leaves you too cold
No WiFi in rooms

Would like to leave a special note of thanks to Shruti at front desk for all the help provided
placeInfo/address: 770/5, F-25, Ramanuja Road Annex Rajendra Kalamandhira, Mysuru (Mysore) 570 004 India

title: Great for a short stay !
text:
Amazing hotel, by all parameters: proximity to tourist places, the Railway Station, Bus Station and what's more, if you're driving, its on the main road. Ample parking (as a person who drives a lot in Bengaluru, this is of paramount importance). The rooms are well appointed and maintained. The staff (as with most Mysoreans) are very courteous and helpful. The in-house restaurant can be improved (have told the management so) but when there are so many options for street food and the fact that we were out most of the day, i wouldn't harp on this a lot. 

Don't forget to ask the staff to take you out on to the terrace at night. Amazing view and if you're staying there overnight on a Sunday ... don't miss seeing the Mysore Palace lit ... its a sight to behold!

All in all, had an amazing weekend trip, walked everywhere and loved the place. Definitely recommended.

title: terrible treebo
text: we were checking out of a beautiful treebo property in Ooty, when i got a call from the next destination - treebo golden castle in mysore. i was looking forward to a fantastic experience in mysore -- just like the one i had in Ooty.. when we checked into the Mysore property, didn't know that the last day of my vacation would be a terrible one.. when we booked the hotel, we didn't knew it was a vegetarian hotel!!!! when i tried to order vegetarian dinner through room service, i was curtly told dinner is not served in the room! we went downstairs to have food, waited and waived the waiters several times to take our order - and was continuously ignored... we didn't even know what was available.. finally me and my kid daughter decided to leave and have the food outside. we noticed other families also followed us. the breakfast next morning was another terrible experience - only south indian vegetarian food was on menu - not even milk-cornflakes or breads were available. my daughter hardly ate anything.. when i asked for black tea, that was not available and the tea that was served was the worst cup of tea i ever had!!!! i was told the restaurant isn't the part of the hotel.. and the behaviour of the restaurant manager was very rude and not expected from a place where i am paying to avail the facilities .. not sure, why treebo is lending its name to this terrible place..

title: Luxury hotel that's also pocket friendly
text:
We stayed at Treebo Golden Castle from 29th - 31st May 2017. This hotel sits bang on main road of Mysore yet the surroundings are not crowded. Market from here is 10 minutes walkable. Famous Mysore palace is 10 minutes drive. Railway station is nearby. Almost every sightseeing or shopping place is 10 minutes drive.  That's the plus point !
We had opted for delux rooms, which are quite specious, cozy and clean. It had mini refrigerator, electric kettle & all necessary toiletries. Standard rooms are less specious though. Still those are good for couples. 
They have pure veg restaurant. Food quality was good but they offered limited number of items in their complimentary breakfast. 
Staff is courteous. People at reception are always ready to help for any kind of need. Whether its shopping, travelling or any other need. They also have in-house travel desk which offers packaged sightseeing tours.  
All in all very nice place to stay at reasonable rates.

title: Wonderful Stay
text:
It’s a very good hotel and situated quite close to palace and zoo. The hotel is nicely built, the rooms are big with AC, chair, table, 32” TV, complimentary tea/ copy, electric kettle….. You can directly book through hotel too and at times they offer some discount and you might get it cheaper than Cleartrip or so. Stay was wonderful. 
The only problem was the restaurant. They have outsourced it and hence have less control on it. The food was good in restaurant and rates too. The quantity was little less maybe that’s why the prices seemed reasonable. The order time was high, around 20 min or so. Meager staff to handle the crowd. We were on the working day, I don’t know how they manage on weekends. Next day was worst. The breakfast was suppose to start at 7.30 and many occupants came down to have it and start the journey/ tour. We couldn’t understand the delay reason as it was difficult to communicate due to non-hindi speaking staff. Later on we understood that the main receptionist and the serving staff was not available though the food was more or less ready. One of the customer took lead and started serving the food too and quickly people could have food and move on.

title: Nothing more of a AC lodge
text:

My experience - 
Room - 
Average size room size, bathroom was spacious, both were clean.
AC (functional in my case :) )
Dirty bed sheet and blanket and worn out linen on runner and cushion cover.
Faulty water kettle.
TV with satellite TV connection.
VLCC toiletries ( shampoo, soap and moisturizer)
Wifi is pathetic.

Staff ( some ) was polite, but be sure to get fake promises.
They don't own a restaurant and seems its a third party that owns it. B'fast was of very limited variety with OK quality food, not good not bad. You won't get lunch or dinner.

Travel desk is pathetic. 

Customer service and needs a lot improvement.

I just spent a transit night and thanks it was only one. On top of all these they ask (charge) 1% if you make payment by card. In my case, I insisted and they rolled it off.

Based on my exp. I do not suggest this or will make any future plans.

- food was not great, the buffet spread was poor though the quality of food was not bad
- the staff need to be trained on how to speak to customers as one of the ladies in the reception was literally trying to chase us away saying they need the room for the next guest, though we had agreed on a time for vacating
- the freebees in the toilet like shampoo / conditioner appear used (half filled)
- there was no door mat outside the bathroom thus leaving little puddles of water ever time somebody stepped into a bath and came out
- The window in the room opened on to a large marriage hall and therefore the din of the music was terrible, though my little daughter enjoyed the evening's party. But for those who desire some peace...well...???

title: Quaint Hotel for A Quick Getaway
text:
We travel regularly from Bangalore to Coonoor with a break at Mysore as the ghar section closes at 6 pm. We find it very convenient to stay at Hotel Viceroy Comforts. It is a budget hotel located in a quiet neighbourhood with enough parking available. The staff is very courteous and helpful. The rooms are Ok with air conditioning.  The best part is that the hotel has lots of deals and you can get decent rooms for as less as Rs 1000/-. It is also located close to the Mysore palace and the road to Ooty.

Recommended for budget travellers.
placeInfo/address: 770/5, F-25, Ramanuja Road Annex Rajendra Kalamandhira, Mysuru (Mysore) 570 004 India

title: Avoid at all costs
text: We checked into this hotel on 2nd May after a tiring journey. We were told the room is ready for us. But on entering, we found that it was far from that. We could not get fresh because there were no towels inside the bathroom. We had to wait for 20 mins for that. That night there were heavy sufrains in Mysore due to which some power cable got cut. It was understandable. However, they did not have alternative arrangement for power. Two hours later power was restored in some of the rooms and ours was not restored. We requested them to provide an emergency light or atleast a candle but they refused. The lifts also were not working. We had dinner in the restaurant upstairs which was terrible. Before leaving, we checked with the restaurant manager when would the power be restored completely. A waiter chipped in and said that we could sit in the rest rooms inside the rooms as there is a back up bulb over there!!! We were taken aback and told them we did not pay to come and sit in rest rooms . When I complained to the general manager, he spoke very rudely and defended his staff's behaviour and slammed the phone. The situation did not improve for the next two days as well. The lift was not operational. No power inside the room, no AC, no internet nothing. We had gone with our 2.5 year old daughter. She was getting scared of sitting in the darkness.  Our request to change the room was also turned down. We were too happy to check out on 4th May but again we received our last dose. Hot water was not avaialble in the bathrooms and they kept telling that they are working on it. After waiting till 11.30, we checked out finally. We demamded a refund as we hardly got any facilities we were promised but the general manager refused telling that they had spent for 50000 rupees on replacing the genset and no discount can be given. Our sincere Advice for anyone booking here , better stay on roadside hotels of Mysore which I think would be much cleaner and serviced better compared to this .
placeInfo/address: 770/5, F-25, Ramanuja Road Annex Rajendra Kalamandhira, Mysuru (Mysore) 570 004 India

title: Avoid

title: Average budget hotel
text:
This was my 2nd trip to mysore and I chose same hotel based on my last experience. I booked 2 non ac rooms again. Here are few pros and cons of this hotel.

Pros:
Nice location: You are just close to palace and in the centre of the town. Infact, if you love walking, you can actually walk around to zoo (2 km away), palace (800m away) etc. There are good eateries around this hotel.
Cost: Its a budget hotel with 900INR for non AC room.

Cons:
1) As I experienced last time, the mattress were of very bad quality and the bed ws too small. So, if you have small kid which will sleep in between, there is good chance that you can fall off from bed edge (because mattress stuff just drops down on edges). And no kidding, I did fall once :)
2) Don't avail food services of the hotel. The food is not at all tasty. In fact, I overheard another traveller complaining about stale food (She probably ordered north indian Aloo Bhaji).
3) Parking: Now this is worst part. They have small parking and normally your car is blocked by any car. Now they don't keep keys with them. They will come to your room and will take the keys to adjust your car so that other car can come out. And if the car owner is not in hotel and taking stroll outside, you are blocked. I waited twice like that. The management should mandatorily keep keys for all the cars there.

Bottomline: Good location. Cheap hotel. Eat food outside. Have fun. Mysore is beautiful.

ps: Last time, I guess I gave better rating to this hotel but they have not improved on mattress quality (they did comment that they will do it). Its been exactly an year and nothings changed. In fact, last year when they didn't have restaurant and they were getting it from outside vendor, food was much better.
ownerResponse/text:
Dear Sir,

Regards,
Team Kings Kastle,

If i come back to Mysore Kings Kastle will not be my choise.

title: Inexpensive for what you get, but noisy
text:
OVERVIEW

Kings Kastle was in a relatively convenient neighbourhood near the palace, although surrounding shops were useless for the usual traveller consumables (toothpaste, tissue etc). It would be a reasonably good choice for the money — if they could deal with the night time noise factor. Excepting traffic noise, this was the noisiest hotel in 5 months of Asian travel.

Check-in / Check-out : PASS
Entrance / Perimeter security : PASS
Restaurant : PASS (for breakfast)

ROOM

Room door security : PASS
Room window security : PASS
Other room security (safe etc.) : N/A
WiFi : PASS
Fan or A/C : PASS
Lighting : PASS
Electric sockets : FAIL. Sockets in the room were okay, but there was a wall socket with a broken face plate inside the bathroom near the shower. This is an electrical short waiting to happen.
Closet / wardrobe : PASS
Natural light : LIMITED due to window facing into the interior courtyard
Window coverings : PASS
TV and programming : PASS
General cleanliness : PASS

BED

Bed mattress quality : PASS
Bed linens quality and cleanliness : FAIL — seemed to have been slept in. Had them changed and still used hostel liners because pillow cases did not seem clean.
Pillow quantity and quality : FAIL 2 flat pillows on double with unclean pillow cases
Mosquito net : N/A

BATHROOM

Cleanliness : PASS
Bathroom cold water : PASS, although sink leaked a small amount
Bathroom hot water : PASS
Bathroom drainage : PASS, although the entire bathroom floor gets swamped taking a shower

OVERALL

Sleep quality : FAIL, due to incessant noise both nights. Dragging furniture upstairs until midnight. Loud voices in the 'echo-chamber' carpark in the courtyard until 2 a.m. Appeals to Reception did not solve the problem. Even in day time, the temple across the street puts speakers out on the sidewalk and blasts music right into the 'echo chamber'.
Value for money : PASS (sleep quality notwithstanding)
Would we use this lodge again? NO

Dear Guest,

Thank you for your review,

Regards,
Team Kings Kastle.

The rooms are provided wit Electric Kettle and Coffee, Tea, Milk and Sugar sachets  and housekeeping is great. Considering the location, comfort and service, the room tariff is really cheap. I sincerely recommend this Hotel to all those who would like to have a comfortable stay at affordable cost while visiting this cultural city of Mysore!  Indeed Value for Money with Comfort & Service Second to None!

title: Average hotel with decent amenities
text: This Resort is located on the outskirts of Mysore & little far from the city(9KMs to Mysore Palace). The hotel is in a calm & isolated location with no development for 3 KM radius, this place would suit for people who have their own vehicle for going around or travelers need to hire a cab through the hotel.  The check-in experience was OK. The rooms are relatively bigger with all the basic amenities you expect from a typical 3 star hotel. There is scope to improve on the cleanliness because though the room looked spacious, it had a very distinct odour (Kind of a unpleasant smell due to dampness). This hotel has got just one restaurant & a small Bar facing the swimming pool. Breakfast spread was limited with an average taste/quality. The ala-carte food seemed to taste much better than the food served in the Dinner or BreakFast Buffet. You don't have much of a choice for food given that you should travel at least 10 KMs to find alternate eating options. They do have a small indoor play area(Snooker, Foos ball, Table tennis, Carom etc). For outdoor sports, they have a small children's play area(swing etc..) & cricket net practice area in the parking. This hotel has a decent sized swimming pool but I didn't like the smell of the water in the pool. Kids pool is closed now for unknown reasons. This is a small resort so you don't get much to do inside the resort. The staffs are courteous but not very professional. Many of them don't understand/speak English. If the hotel management addresses some of the main concerns mentioned in this review, I am sure this hotel will become one of the worthwhile places to stay in Mysore for travelers but for now its a long way to go.
ownerResponse/text: Greetings from JAL MAHAL RESORT & SPA,Mysore !!! Thank you for sharing your wonderful experience with us. We are delighted to know that the services rendered were up to your expectations Looking forward to the pleasure of welcoming you back to JAL MAHAL RESORT & SPA,Mysore ”
placeInfo/address: Bannur Road Varuna, Hobli, Mysuru (Mysore) 570011 India

title: absolute gem with a pocket friendly tag
text:
This is an absolute gem with a pocket friendly tag. With Mysore Palace being just a fifteen minute drive, this resort has it all.

If you like the feeling of being amidst natural beauty then this place will certainly not disappoint you. The walk way to the lobby / reception is beautiful and covered with sheltering trees. The rooms are clean, spacious and have a traditional touch with all the modern features that one could ask for. 

The outdoor dining is worth the mention too. Several small covered seating arrangements amidst the garden make this a rather cozy place to have a candle light dinner. 
The food is of good standard and the portions suit the price you pay.

Other amenities such as swimming pool, game area with the options of table tennis, fussball table, snooker, badminton, gym etc. There is also a separate area with slides, swings etc for children. 

There is also the option for a full fledged bar for those looking to sip it up.

The Spa service has been shut so a relaxing massage is not on the cards. I guess it would be fair to say that the greenery will certainly have a refreshing effect on your mind and body.

The room service and housekeeping department do justice every bit.

Overall I highly recommend Jal Mahal to those looking for a quick get away from the city life just to chill. Please keep in mind that having a vehicle is recommended. Not too sure if there are sufficient cab services available at Mysore.

Keep up the hospitality.
placeInfo/address: Bannur Road Varuna, Hobli, Mysuru (Mysore) 570011 India

title: Average
text:
To begin with, the resort is quite far from city and absolutely nothing around for good 2-3 kms. No OLA / UBER will come as it's out of range and it's a pain if u don't take ur own vehicle. The local taxis create a fuss to get there cos of the placement and distance.  Also, the food is very highly priced and of avg quality. Buffet tastes good only on Sunday, o ther days it's below avg, cos u guessed it right, low crowd. The mattress is of weird quality. It's very slippery on edges and I almost fell twice from bed while sleeping.  Hot water goes off and nobody cares to fix it. Tap in washroom was stuck and unable to operate, they didn't care to fix it. Purely money minded. As simple as it.  They don't even give complementary news paper. They insist on nylon costume in swimming pool to sell their swimwear.  Also they forced us to pay for a broken water glass which we didn't even touch.
Though it's serene and peaceful, it's quite small place.  Better go to something where the accessibility is good.

title: TREEBO....The BEST.....Budget Hotel, with satisfaction............
text:
May 2017- Booking for three days was done over phone and it was really in our budget and with all amenities and complementary breakfast and Free Wi-Fi. 

The great thing is that Treebo has not even taken any advance payment for the booking. Just two days before they have requested a miss call through SMS ...for confirmation, and that's it... You are Confirmed Checked- IN.

Location - its very prominent and on the main road, thus no problem of searching or parking, cellar parking is also available.

Room - was really sufficient for all out family members.

Cleanness - it was done daily and up to our satisfaction.

Staff -  They are really caring and courteous.

Tea/Coffee -  They have kept electric Kettle for self service.... and they do not mind providing you any number of tea sachets.

The area which required little concern is the attached restaurant where they are providing  Vegetarian Breakfast, Lunch and Dinner. for Non Veg food ... there are lot of hotels outside which can really satisfy you.

Overall its really the Best ....deal I have ever had..... Please try to book through Treebo and I am sure you will be satisfied.

title: More than Expectation..Value for money
text: I booked this hotel at the last minute through make my trip site on last minute booking deal. I am very much satisfied with the hotel and would love staying in this hotel anytime in future when I visit mysore. There are few reasons which made me like this hotel. I am listing down for your benefit. Anyplace if you visit by your own car the first thing you would look out for is a safe parking space for your car. Just before booking this hotel, I called them and enquired about the parking facilities there, I got a reply from them that they have an ACRE space to park the cars. I thought they were kidding but its true, The car parking space was awesome, 100 or even more cars can be parked at a time there. Then , on the checkin. Since I booked this hotel from chennai and then started to mysore right away, I reached the place only by 1am Midnight. This place is situated right in the heart of mysore , just a km away from the mysore palace. The hotel reception person ( donno his name ) was kind enough to guide me the route to hotel and also made a smooth and quick checkin process as we were already tired after travelling the whole day. The lifts were very good and the entire facility was clean. We were offered a room at level 2. After seeing the ambiance, we were expecting the rooms to be neat and we are NOT disappointed in it. Rooms were lot spacious and neat. Bathrooms were good too with all basic needs kept right there in perfectly packed state. A nice running Split A/c and a LCD tv is more than enough for a room. They had them both and in addition the rooms had a small sofa arrangement along with writing table chairs and coffee maker / Hot water kettle which helped us prepare hot water for our kid. Morning buffet was provided for us complimentary. There is a scope of improvement here on the varieties they serve. The quality was good but variety could have had some more to that. Basic bread varieties , corn flakes , south indian specials , a fruit and hot beverages would be there. Fair enough. The hotel provided free Wifi access too but restricted to hotel lobby alone. I had plans to proceed further to coorg for which I had to make the last minute booking for which I needed internet facility. I used the wifi in lobby and did the booking. At times, wifi connectivity was throwing error, but the manager was kind enough to resolve it at the earliest. Overall, I am much satisfied with this hotel and I would definitely recommend it for anyone who doesn't wish to make a mess out of their trip.
placeInfo/address: 770/5, F-25, Ramanuja Road Annex Rajendra Kalamandhira, Mysuru (Mysore) 570 004 India

title: comparatively ok hotel

title: Decent place.
text:
Although the name and appearance of this place is imposing but facts lies somewhere else. The name of this place gives you a feeling as if this is an erstwhile palace coverted into a heritage hotel but it is not the case. As you enter the premises you get a feeling that this is a star hotel coz of the sheer amount of its parking space and the main facade. But when you realise that the main facade is a multipurpose hall and not a part of the hotel and the huge parking space is for the functions that are held in that hall your enthusiasm about this place evaporates.

Actually this hotel is not bad in itself. Pluses being proximity to the tourists attractions biggest of them being Mysore Palace. The rooms are spacious but lack ventilation. If you happen to open your windows there is hospital next to it and there are chances of fowl smell emanating from it. The rooms are AC by that I mean they only have ACs and no fans so just in case u r feeling the chill and want to switch of the AC you cant do that coz there is no chance of ventilation.

Beds are big, clean and comfy matresses. Clean sheets and towels. Pretty decent toileteries in the bathroomm. It has one restaurant and its pure veg. Breakfast menu although repetetive is good. Room service is prompt. Check in & Check Out was swift.

All in all a decent place to stay in Mysore.
placeInfo/address: 770/5, F-25, Ramanuja Road Annex Rajendra Kalamandhira, Mysuru (Mysore) 570 004 India

title: Budget hotel with friendly and helpful people
text:
We stayed for one night in the hotel and found it to be worth the value that we paid for. We got the deal off a travel portal and were happy with the hotel.

The rooms are a bit small but good enough if your plan is to go around sightseeing. The food served is very good through variety is limited. 

The best feature of the hotel is the staff who are cordial, helpful and accommodating. We had a slight issue of overstay which was taken care by the manager in an amicable manner. Everybody else in the place, from the security to the bell boy had a smile on their faces at all times. 

The parking is a bit small but I am sure they have other arrangements  elsewhere. Overall a good stay.

title: Bed-Bugs, Loud nights, cramped rooms and water jugs with fungus.
text: Comment: PATHETIC. in caps. This hotel has an acute problem of bed bugs.And the management was reluctant to listen. The rooms are small and cramped. All the rooms face central parking. Vehicles keep moving in/out the entire night and early morning. Because of the closed space you can hear drunk guests talking loud over phone and loud televisions till late night. It was overall pathetic experience. It ruined our entire stay. It was a family stay had the misfortune of using three rooms in the same hotel. And unfortunately all the rooms had bed -bugs. Please do not ever go close to this hotel if you do not want to trouble your family. The manager Mr Bhat is an weirdo who does not listen to your complaints and he does not care if you are comfortable or not. AVOID at any cost unless you want bed bugs to come to your home with luggage.

title: Noisy and rude ripoff
text:
My wife and I stayed there for 2 days.
+: in the centre of the city, hair dryer, decent service in the restaurant;
-: noisy, rude in making you pay extra, terrible laundry service.

The rooms are around an inner court topped by a roof, which serves also as a garage. There is a wide exit to the busy street, so the thing is like an echo chamber. The windows are towards this lobby-garage, so there is no use of them.

Both in the reservation e-mail and when checking-in, I asked for a quiet room with AC. Although the answer was positive, we were offered a room where noise came in through the door (from the lobby-garage) and through the bathroom window (from the outside traffic). Asked for another one and were given one with no bathroom window (so noise just through the door) and no AC. When checking-out, I was asked to pay the original AC tariff and a dinner was not included. I told the 2 ladies that we never had the AC room, but they said it was not possible to change the room type in their system. Then why did they even offer me a non-AC room? When I mentioned also the dinner that was missing, they called the restaurant and confirmed it, added the 550 INR and 'applied a discount of 200 INR for the AC'. Just that the tariff discrepancy, on their website, between AC and non-AC, is 399 INR / day, which would mean 798 INR for 2 days, rather than their 200 INR discount.

As for their laundry service, it was fast, but we got blood-like, grease-like and white stains on our clothes.

Don't expect to get any sleep, it's just too noisy.
ownerResponse/text:

We appeal to you not to form an opinion of our hotel based on the last experience you had and request you to give us another opportunity to redeem ourselves.

Please let me know when you visit the Mysore City next and I will personally ensure that you have a very memorable stay with us. The entire team at Kings Kastle looks forward to that privilege. We appreciate the feedback and will use it to fine tune our operations in the hope that upon your next visit we can exceed your expectations.

And as you mentioned, I checked with housekeeping but you have not given any cloths for laundry.

Regards

title: A Good Budget Hotel
text:
We had planned a day trip in Mysore and booked this place as a budget option. I did not have high expectations from this place, but I was not at all disappointed.
This Hotel is located on the main road and near to Mysore Palace and Zoo. The place and rooms were clean and had all the basic amenities. 
They also have a restaurant which served good food, initially I was reluctant to have my lunch here, but ended up having my dinner here too. The food was really good, however I felt that the quantity was not justified for the price charged. I would also request to start serving proper atta chappatis.
This hotel is a collectable of Chinese products, LED lights, Electric Kettle, Door Locks, Electric Safe, etc. They had Electric Kettle in the rooms with Tea & Coffee making kit provided complimentary. 
I would also suggest them to improve on their bedding, the mattress was loaded with springs, It would have been better if they have a coir or some other mattress that provides more comfort.

title: хороший бюджетный отель ы центре города
text: Отель удобно расположен в центре города, 10-15 минут от  вокзала на тук-туке, очень близко к автобусной остановке, католическому храму и дворцу магараджи. Номера небольшие, чистые, есть чайник, горячая вода весь день без проблем. Есть бесплатный WI FI, который отлично ловится на рецепшене и  в коридорах, хуже в номере. Персонал на стойке регистрации доброжелателен, узнали расписание поездов для нас, заказали в интернете билете и съездили сами выкупили их на железнодорожном вокзале. Завтрак в кафе на крыше довольно скудный – кофе, тосты с джемом, омлет. В кафе есть выход на балкон, с которого открывается красивый вид на мечеть и католический храм.

title: A good hotel to stay in Mysore
text:
With its location in almost the centre of most of Mysore's attractions it is in a well placed location.
St.Philomena's church, Mysore palace, Mysore zoo, n a few more attractions are well within 3-5 kms of this hotel.
With a night's stay at Rs. 2800 for a a/c 4 bed room, it was at a good price as well.
The staff including the manager was quite friendly and assisted whenever we needed some help.
The food at the restaurant was good and would have got a thumbs up from me but for its delayed serving time. We once had to wait for more than an hour in our room for our food even when there is an extra 10% for room service.
Apart from this the only other con was lack of sufficient parking space for cars.

title: Decent Budget Hotel
text:
This hotel is in the heart of city. I stayed there from 2 Oct to 4 Oct 2013. Intercom phone never worked during that time. We stayed at room 207 at first floor. It was 3 bed room (we were 3 adults & my 4 years daughter) Room was precious enough considering this as budget hotel.  Hot water was available for 24 hours. They should improve lighting system in toilet.
Hotel does not have its own restaurant. Talking about room service, we ordered only milk but quality was not good. So we preferred to eat outside. 

Staff at reception was polite and they allowed extra time for check out. They have 24 hours check out. 

You can see Mysore palace lighting on Sunday and on all holidays at ~7:30 pm. During that time roads towards palace are crowed.  In such conditions it is better to book hotel near to the palace.

title: Value for money
text:
I stayed at this place on July 21-22. First, the hotel has a 24 hour check out policy. So you dont end up paying for the second day if you check in late on the first day. Second, it is centrally located, near the KSRTC bus stand (sub urban bus stand), a 5-6 minute walk from it. Railway station would be a bit longer, but Rs. 30 in an auto rickshaw. Third, rooms are very clean, decor done up well, with even mood lightings ! fourth, toilets are very clean, with running hot water promised. The toilet seats were also sanitised. But... (1) windows face the passage / courtyard, and there is no other ventilation. (2) They have room service, but they get the food from some other place. And food was not all that great.

Apart from that, it was a value for money. Definitely would stay here if I visited Mysore again.
ownerResponse/text: Thanks for your feedback. We are opening a brand new roof garden restaurant in a months time. It would be a veg/non veg multi cuisine restaurant. We will guarantee you will have a better food next time.

title: claim high , serve poor
text:
As a family we got 3 premier double rooms  and stayed between 19 to 21st may 2012.  First experience itself was a bad experience as they have not provided any towels. When called house keeping no one picked up the call. called up reception 3 times then they send a room boy with small hand towels ans telling us that they do not have stock of towels and would be available at 4 30 pm. one of the rooms, AC was not working and we had to call 3 times to register the complaint. AC problem was not attended till 9.30 pm on that night and when we went down to reception, they were cool in saying that fans will be provided and asked  us to take up with manager next day morning. Refused to even change the the room. It  was a horrible night as it was very hot day and it really spoilt the mood. other miscerys are
1. Drinking water was served only after 1 hr  15 mins after the request was made 3 times.
2 provided the same menu of lunch as the dinner and even though alcarte was available, refused to provide. when took up, reply was it was their std.
3 in one of the rooms ,  main door latch was not lockable and had to keep the doors just closed and managed the night
4. In the same room, water tap handle comes out easily
5 In the same room,  there was a door which connects to next  room and   they  are so careless the ydid not even bother to lock it and by accident we came to know that.
6. Hot water is not availble for bath after 10 am
7.No information leaflet/ broachure in the room 
etc.etc. etc.

When we made the complaint on the final day to  the manager incharge, he simply said sorry and refused to adjust the tarrif for the non functioning of AC in one of the rooms
placeInfo/address: 770/5, F-25, Ramanuja Road Annex Rajendra Kalamandhira, Mysuru (Mysore) 570 004 India

title: Staty away from this place!
text:
The service in this hotel has become dismal and the employees take the business for granted. The rooms in this hotel are comfortably large, but that is about the only good thing here. There is a marriage hall in the same complex which makes the surrounding pretty noisy and busy. The worst part is the the break fast buffet. They don't serve on time and run out of food. Several items are simply not served when they have less customers in the hotel. 

The employees are indifferent about customers' complaints and the owner was missing! We also encountered mosquitoes in the corridors and in the room. There are much better places in Mysore if you are looking for hotels.
placeInfo/address: 770/5, F-25, Ramanuja Road Annex Rajendra Kalamandhira, Mysuru (Mysore) 570 004 India

title: Very comfortable stay & value for money...
text:
We stayed in Viceroy comforts for 3 nights. It is a value for money hotel. Pretty neat and clean. We had taken deluxe rooms which were very spacious and well decorated. The bathrooms were clean and had most of the modern ameities. Room service was also upto the mark. The only disappointing aspect was the COMPLIMENTARY BREAKFAST which had very little options. The normal idly, dosas and plain bread(no toaster available). 

We went in September 2011. They didnt have any kitchen back at that time and got their food from of of their sister concern hotel. There are lot of other restaurants in the vicinity, so food is not a problem. They have a room service menu with most of the options. The portions are good and the price is above average

The hotel staff were cordial and cheerful led by Ms Anusha Aradhya at the reception. The location is not in the heart of the city but other parts of the city is easily accesible from the hotel.

It is not a business hotel but very good for family stays. It has a huge parking space and most of the people know the hotel.

Overall i would defiinitely recommend families to go and stay there. We had a good time.
placeInfo/address: 770/5, F-25, Ramanuja Road Annex Rajendra Kalamandhira, Mysuru (Mysore) 570 004 India

title: Good hotel but badly managed
text:
Good spacious n clean rooms. Easily located from the road. Close proximity to rly stn n bus stand. Hotel does not offer buffet breakfast and have to chose 2 dishes out of the given as a result a lot of food gets wasted as someone may not like the dish that has been served. Also the hotel has a pure veg restaurant which is a let down for foodies but enough food joints around which compensate this.

The authorized travel agent (Anu Travels) will fool you with things as in will not give you things as promised and I had arguments with him on the same. Plz avoid booking through him, one may get multiple other options.

title: Good budget stay
text:
Great budget hotel. Spacious rooms, lots of amenities in the rooms. Located at a great location for road trippers to/from Bangalore. Service is prompt and check-in was smooth.

There is no breakfast buffet. Instead you choose two dishes from five and wait for the only server in the restaurant to bring them to you. You have to remind them to bring you your food every 15 minutes. Won't recommend a breakfast plan here. In that time, you can venture into Mysore city and find a great place with a much better service. 

My 3/5 is only because Treebo is discounting right now and because they spoiled our breakfast, wasted 40 crucial minutes of our road trip. Exiting Mysore in the morning out towards NH44 via Chamrajnagar is a problem because of traffic.

title: Good rooms, bad policies
text: I don't know if this is the case with all hotels in Mysore, but I have faced religious discrimination on my stay here. As part of our honeymoon, we were travelling by road to Ranganathittu Bird Sanctuary and had to take a stop at Mysore for a night. The folks at the reception counter freaked out and started whispering to each other as soon as they saw, from our id cards, that we belong to different religious backgrounds. They whispered to each other and made calls, while we were waiting at the reception looking like idiots on our honeymoon. When I approached the fellows and asked them what problem they have with us, they said there is some new policy about not allowing "inter-caste couples". When I told them that it's not for them to decide what religion or caste their guests belong to, and that we are a married couple on our honeymoon who can provide our marriage certificate on the spot, their attitude immediately changed and they checked us in. They could have just asked us if we're married first and that would have been fine. But, they thought it best to whisper to each other and peer into our id cards to dissect our names and show it to each other and then call up some "manager for permission". I must admit the room was excellent, but this is no way to conduct a hotel business in a secular country. They might as well put a saffron flag on the hotel building. Being reporters, both of us could have made a big scene about it. We decided to let it go because we didn't want to get upset on our honeymoon, but then, they did upset us. We expect better from upmarket hotels like Treebo.

title: Decent but can be better
text:
Firstly a couple of points that need improvement: 
1.  The room allotted to us - ie 205 has a noisy AC.  It kept making these loud scary sounds every 15 mins - but since we we just stopping over for a couple of hrs we let it be.  
2.  The breakfast would have been more exciting if we had the usual buffet - somehow selecting 2 options from the list of 4 kinda put a damper on the meal.  (Maybe its just me but i love my breakfast spread when I'm travelling - its one of the things i really look forward to)
3.  The room was missing the usual list of nos - 9 for reception etc.  If i was a 1st time traveller - I'm sure id be feeling lost.  

Other than that .. the room with respect to cleanliness & ambience seemed really good.  The team at the reception during checkin was polite and courteous and the checkin was absolutely hassle free.  Stay at this place is indeed value for money.

title: Good value for money
text:
We stayed in Kings Kastle on Ashoka road for one night. The location is qood, as it's quite close to the palace. They also arrange for city tours, which is nice as it avoids haggling with local tour operators. 

Since there were four people in our group, we booked the 4 bed AC room from makemytrip. The hotel seemed to be a new construction and was quite clean and well maintained. Wifi speed was good and uninterrupted, and the room was also good. They have LED lighting on the false ceiling, which makes it a little unique. Toilets were clean when we arrived, and we were provided four sets of towels and bedsheets. They also have room service (but no restaurant), but we just ate at a local restaurant nearby. 

The only complaint I had was that even though we booked what they call a '4 bed room', the room just had one queen bed and a sofa that folds out into a bed. The sofa-cum-bed was quite uncomfortable as there was a hard wooden plan right where you back goes. Plus no extra blankets were provided. So it's better to book two twin rooms instead of the family room.

title: A Nice Property, sinking due to bad maintainence
text:
Kings Kastle hotel is located in Ashoka Road, very close to St. Philomena's Church and the Railway station. The entrance is not very visible and it is possible to miss it if your are not careful. The staff are friendly and there is parking and WiFi available. May not be suitable for travelers who need everything to be spic and span.

Stayed there for one night with family.

Pro's
* Decent room size.
* Three bedded rooms available.
* Complimentary WiFi.
* TV Available with cable.
* Helpful staff.
* Rates discounted from the published tariff.
* Indoor Parking available.
* Driver's accommodation available.
* Room Service available.
* Geyser available for hot water in the bath.
* Tea/Coffee Kettle in the room with complimentary sachets of tea/coffee. Not sure if it is replenished.
* Electronic safe available.
* Visa/Master cards accepted.
* Power back up available.

Con's
* Needs a lot of maintenance.
* Rates on EP only.
* No in house restaurant/kitchen.
* Food served brought from outside and hence limited.
* Food bills can't be added to the room and need to be settled immediately.
* Towels/Sheets though washed have aged and need replacement.
* Only soap available in the wash room.
* Language barrier with the staff. They are comfortable only with Kannada except the Front Office Staff who can manage English.
* High tax structure.
* Staff not very knowledgeable on the taxes.
ownerResponse/text: Thank you for your feedback.

title: Good Accomodation at Royal City
text:

We were looking for double bed but were upgraded to Family room at a good price. The family room is very good with 2 comfortable double beds, A/C, TV, mini Fridge and a small cupboard. The interiors are good with cute lighting system. The toilet was clean with hot water facility. At present they do not have in house restaurant but they organise food from outside. The food is good, reasonably priced and the service is also quick. They have very small parking space for cars. 

Overall it is value for money.

title: Ne pas se fier à l'apparence!
text:
Le hall de l'hôtel est agréable, la chambre est grande et il y a une belle salle d'eau, mais....une légère (et cependant persistante!) odeur d'égout et de moisissures flotte dans la chambre. Narines délicates, passez votre chemin.
Au rez de chaussée, nous avons pris le dîner: restaurant végétarien, propre pas cher mais peu de choix sur la carte.
Petit déjeuner indien,..... sinon rien (pas de toasts, pas d'oeuf....). Le thé est en supplément !!! Donc nous préférons partir sans prendre de petit déjeuner.
Finalement, il vaut mieux choisir un autre hôtel!

title: Good hotel in competitive budget.
text: I stayed there for one night. Looks like this was a newly build hotel. Rooms were clean, but it is exactly good for 2 adult not more than that (not even an infant). Parking arrangement was fine. But the improvement point is "that should build up own restaurant with plenty recipe". Because currently they bring food from outside, but still i will say it is fast. It is located close to center of city, just opposite to the "state bank of mysore". That area is little crowded, but inside the hotel is not at all noisy. Rooms were clean, and best part is there is a "Good night active" available in every room :-).... Good to hear that they are taken this step after "Dengue" problem started in Karnataka. Do not expect to have internet connectivity, but good 3G connection in that area. I would say, better to bring food from outside for lunch and dinner. Overall stay was good.

title: Rooms are good value, if you can cope with the noise
text:
Accommodation at this new hotel in Mysore looks good on first impressions, and seems like solid value with rates starting from 1,000 Rupees. The beds are fine, there is cable TV and mostly there is hot water (though not necessarily in the morning when you really want it). 

However it is located on a noisy street with a LOT of honking and the rooms are situated around a courtyard carpark that is like an echo chamber, amplifying tuk tuks revving in and out, doors slamming and the staff who are constantly bellowing at each other. An air vent above the door that destroys any sound insulation does not help matters. The bathrooms are also quite smaill and there is little natural light.from the courtyard facing window.

There is complimentary Wifi, but I had to ask five times before I received the information that allowed me to log on. The rooms are clean and present quite well, but I found the noise level maddening. It's a pity noise was not taken into consideration during the design of this hotel, as otherwise it would be a good mid-range choice.
ownerResponse/text:
Thanks for your valued feedback. We remember that there was an festival/event organized just opposite to our hotel during your stay. We had mentioned this noise is because of the festival arrangement throughout the city for a day during this time of the year. Otherwise we are going full occupancy and not much issues on the noise level.  

Wifi issue was because of the bad Service from BSNL. We have changed the WIFI vendor to a reputed private organization and the technical/service issue has been taken care.
placeInfo/address: No 69 Ashoka Road, Mysuru (Mysore) 570001 India

title: Decent stay
text:
Stayed here as family ( 5 people including a kid - 2 rooms). The rooms and bathrooms  are decently spacious and clean and beds are comfortable.
They have 3 different restaurants serving different cuisine ( south Indian Veg, Chinese and continental, north Indian) which are good. 

Additionally they have a parking in the basement( though it was not clean, may be because of some renovation going on at the time of our visit)
 
Location of this hotel is at the city center, which is close to all the tourist places of interest in the city.

The only cons - a couple of receptionists need soft skills training. ( On arrival the lady at desk insisted on cash payment and  bluntly refused to accept card payment for additional person in the room. Though this was sorted out  later during checkout, and they accepted card payment  when the other receptionist at service spoke to the management 
Overall. Second incident was when the access card of the room was not working and I went down to the reception and stated my concern that the card did not work 3 times in both the rooms since check in that afternoon .  The  reply I got from the receptionist was " I don't think so ", which was shocking and annoying. Though he did something on the computer and the issue did not reoccur.

Comfort - 4/5
Cleanliness - 4/5
Cost - 4/5
Service - 2 ( majorly because of unfriendly approach of receptionist )
Breakfast ( complimentary) - 3.5/5 ( only veg)
Location - 4.5/5

Overall - I would recommend this hotel.

title: Nice but not a true Treebo
text: Stayed there with my wife for two days. Everything was very clean and comfortable. But some small things were not up to expectations. Very good location, fifteen minutes to Mysuru railway station. Lot of eateries nearby. The hotel has a travel desk which was friendly and reasonable in price. The Chinese non-vegetarian food was excellent but the complimentary breakfast was limited and average. The room was huge and bed was very comfortable. The bad part was the air-conditioner was making cracking noise frequently which was very disturbing at night. There was a tea coffee maker but the provisions were limited. They also had given one complimentary mineral water bottle for two persons! The wi-fi was weak and never got connected smoothly. The bathroom was huge and had a bathtub, but did not have bath curtains. So whenever we took a bath, the whole room almost got wet. The basin was slightly low and the mirror over the basin was also low. It was pretty difficult to shave. Staff were friendly and sober. Overall good experience but not like a true Treebo!

title: Average hotel
text:
We stayed here for 1 night on our way to Coonoor from Pune. 
Pros - Location and basement parking facilities. Plus a special mention to the security guard who went a step ahead and cleaned our car. Plus the downstairs "Veg only" restaurant service was great.
Cons - Based on few of our experience , we found that the hotel management (including Treebo management) was naive and unprofessional. 
1. First of all when we checked in  , there were no towels in the bathroom and after we called the reception twice , we got them. Normally you dont see that in any standard business hotels. 
2. Then we had a very sour experience with the dinner which we took at the upstairs restaurant as the hotel served non veg upstairs. While the food was good , the restaurant service was slow and very poor. Plus the restaurant was adamant on paying the food bill right away and asked for cash as their card swipe machine was somehow not working - which was very strange and naive on their part. 
3. Then came another bitter experience - that was during checkout. While I had paid the room charges in advance , the front desk guy insisted to pay the charges citing that they don't accept the advance payment. It was after I showed them my credit card statement (had to download the same) , and him contacting the finance department , that I was allowed to check out - with the whole process taking 40 minutes. It seems there is a BIG DISCONNECT between Treebo finance team and the hotel management and ultimately I had to suffer for the same. Even now I have not got my hotel bill as the receptionist kindly said that my payment is not settled in their hotel management system. 
Overall impression - While hotel itself was good and was located at a very nice location and rooms were decent , the hotel service was not up to the mark.

title: Well Beyond Expectations
text:
My wife and I stayed at this hotel on our way back from a Nagarhole National Park visit. We booked this place about a week before our trip based on reviews on Trivago.com and the short duration of our stay. Just so you know, I have never been more satisfied with a hotel room like this one for the price that I paid. (Rps. 1450 per night)

The hotel is located on a main road in Mysore very close to the railway station, palace and other places of interest. From the outside its a little understated, similar to other hotels on this strip. But once you step in, its a whole different world. The reception is spacious and extremely clean. Varsha at the reception was very kind and cordial helping us check in quickly and easy. We requested rooms towards the rear of the hotel away from the main road to avoid the noise. 

The rooms themselves are very spacious, clean and well appointed with a large bathroom, excellent shower, powerful air conditioning, fast WiFi and a big screen TV in case you need it. We had absolutely no complaints about it. I still couldn't believe the deal we got for this room and what was being offered! 

The restaurant on the ground floor is also wonderful with tasty food priced affordably. The staff are also very courteous and service was quick. They offer complimentary breakfast which was also delicious. 

I honestly don't know why you wouldn't choose this place to stay in Mysore unless you seek a higher level of luxury or you're on a company account. Its clean, spacious, convenient to access and has great food. If we are in Mysore again, we're definitely staying here again.

title: Would stay again
text: We just stayed for one night here. We are not really city people so one night in Mysore was quite enough for us and we also found that we were able to see everything there was to see in one day. However Golden Castle is a good place to stay and well located for seeing all the main sites. We actually walked everywhere and found we didn't need rickshaws. The hotel is quite new and everything still feels very new and clean. Our bedroom was spacious and there was even room to roll out my yoga mat and do yoga in the morning. They also have nice hot showers which is something we have not always found in India. The only negatives were the breakfast and the inability of the staff to give us a map. We wanted to walk around the city but of course cannot use google maps without internet and most hotels we have stayed in before have had maps available but this one didn't and that made things a bit difficult as they also couldn't tell us where to get a map from. At breakfast time we headed to the main restaurant where breakfast was served but upon seeing that we were westerners we were then ushered away to a separate restaurant upstairs where we were told we could have eggs. We had the eggs but this was literally all they gave us and there also wasn't anything to drink except tea or coffee, for example no juice or water. I am not sure if we would have had more choice if we had been allowed to stay downstairs but I think it would be better if they served the western style breakfasts in the same place as the Indian ones so that everybody can have choice. However the restaurants looked like they would be very nice places for dinner, especially the vegetarian Indian one downstairs and we wish we had eaten here instead of the place we did choose for our dinner (park lane hotel) as it looked much nicer.

title: Comfortable Stay. VFM with added bonus of helpful staff
text:
It's a relatively new hotel and we stumbled upon it by chance. 

We were Pleasantly surprised by the room and the cost factor. The hotel is worth every penny you spend. 

Rooms : Large, Clean, with cozy bed , clean linens and nice view. The lightening fixtures are a good touch.

Toilets : Large, Clean with adequate toiletries.

Parking  :Available

Best part was the Room Service and Staff. very polite, helpful and non interfering. Will definitely recommend for their service. During one of the nights when power cut was on and generator was non functional, they went on to the extent to call local electricity board office and Assistant engineer to log a issue and follow up on same.

A functional restaurant will be really nice addition to the hotel.

Will definitely recommend to all. Go for it. It's at right location, at right price and with right amenities.

title: Avoid if possible
text:
Well we stayed here for one day, and is that's the reason the service was so bad then I have nothing to say. The room was average , nothing special and we weren't expecting anything out of the ordinary. What irritated me was first the front desk was rude and took like forever to get us checked in. Then once we went in the room , the bathrooms were wet with water every where. There were no towels , no even hand towels. After calling them twice did the house keeping service gut come. When  I asked him why it was like that , he didn't have a answer. Next we ordered in-room service, the food was average. Then they came with the bill and insisted that we pay there and then , when we asked can't it wait and put in the room bill. They said no. Horrible. Even the breakfast is limited. You get to choose from 6 things and that's all. You can choose upto two things nothing more.
Avoid if you can..

title: Very nice and modern hotel!
text:
The reception staff was very kind and helpful. 
​
Room was amazing! Very nice bathroom with great water pressure!
The WiFi was fast, but quite annoying to log on to and to stay connected.
Breakfast was simple, but good. They should probably add some chairs and tables so everybody can sit.

​There was some construction going on, but we weren't too bothered by it. 
Restaurants are across the street.
Train station closeby (6 minutes riskhaw) which was convenient for us.

The laundry service is HORRIBLE! Please don't use this 'service' in this hotel! 2 shirts were ruined by someone else's clothes and they never appologized for it! Clothes didn't smell clean after the wash. On top of that, 2 shorts were missing and had 2 pieces of someone else's clothes instead. The laundry guy wanted to rip us off by overcharging us 200%. After we complained at the front desk, the manager helped us out and she was very understanding about the situation and acted very professional.

Overall we had a very nice stay and we can definitely recommend this hotel! (just not the laundry service!)

title: A decent hotel close to the Railway Station
text:
Stayed for one night on Aug 27th, did my booking through booking.com, got a good deal.
Check in went off smoothly, the room was spacious clean and neat, staff were helpful.

The breakfast was complimentary and OK, the room they served breakfast was very cramped and could not accomodate the guests. No restaurant in the hotel, have to pick up from outside, couple of choices available opposite the hotel, which is OK.

It is about 1 km plus to the railway station.

It is a no smoking hotel, which I didnt know while booking, had to keep going out whenever there was a need to smoke which was a pain.

There was some renovation work being done, and there was a constant noise due to this, which was disturbing while trying to catch a nap in the afternoon.

Overall is a good place to stay for the amount they charged

title: Good experience, great value for money and helpful staff
text:
Treebo Golden Castle is a new hotel and is still finding its foot. 

It was a great find though. Great rooms and friendly staff made the experience worthwhile. 

They do not have a restaurant set up yet but hope  to have one operational very soon. The only area where it  would make a positive difference.

We had issues with internet as well as power losses but the staff worked to get these sorted, as well as they could within their abilities. Even to the extent of calling the owners late in the night to arrange for backup generators.

Will definitely chose to stay here repeatedly.

title: Nice and comfortable stay within budget
text:
Went there with husband for office work. The hotel is near to railway station. The staff is very nice. The rooms are clean. They give complimentary water, tea bags, coffee, soap, shampoo and moisturiser. They will refill the items when they cklean the room. But you have to tell at the reception to clean the rooms.
Food: Idli, poha/noodles, egges(2), tea, coffee, bread butter-jam, watermelon juice, fruits etc. Very tasty food. Breakfast usually starts at 8:30 am.
TV: Good TV but no english channels.
Wifi: Only 400 MB per day.
Autos and taxis are easily available.

title: Disappointed
text:
Rooms are pretty decent for the price. Surprisingly saw foreigners staying there too. However, they forced me to check out even though I had clearly mentioned at the time of booking that I would need to check out at 3 pm instead of the standard 11 a.m. time. And even when I was ready to pay extra for extending the stay, I was asked to check out. I ended up hunting for a last minute hotel booking just for 3 hours! 

Will definitely NOT recommend anyone after such poor service.

So you are mostly left with eating dinner from one of the many restaurants just across the road.

title: Good and decent hotel with excellent service – Value for Money.
text:
I had booked the hotel for my family (group booking).  Location of hotel is very good, easy access to tourist places. 
The call center executive was very polite and gave information about hotel and services very clearly and patiently. She also gave me combination of rooms to get better rates.  I was very much convinced  to book this hotel, after talking the call center executive. 
I had  requested for early check in and hotel obliged subject to availability. 
It is a new property and rooms are specious, clean and up to the standards. The staff is good and attentive. 
Breakfast was not served hot and service was not up to hotel’s standards. (Still the hotel don’t have their own restaurants and breakfast is outsourced from catering co).
Hotel offers limited free wifi (500 mb) which is not sufficient. 
Had an opportunity to meet the owners of this hotel and they are very enthusiastic to take feedback from guests.

title: Good stay
text:
A 3 yr old hotel, but well maintained. We booked thru expedia (1400 rupees) which in India, allows you to reserve the room and the flexibility to pay money at checkout.
Good Vegetarian restaurants are not available closeby. The nearest one is Nalpak restaurant. The hotel is 3 kms from Mysore palace. We even had our car washed by the security guy for 50 bucks. Overall a satisfying stay.

Good things to go with:
Clean rooms (200 sq.ft)
Bathroom of very high quality
Beds are comfortable
Wide staircase steps
Wifi-good speed

The not so good things:
Parking is an issue as there is hardly space for 5-6 cars
In-house restaurant is not available, but they bring food from outside (7 km away) which is of average quality. We had only eaten breakfast here.

text:

It had big , spacious rooms and was sparkling clean. It even had wifi and subscription of all HD channels, enabling me to share hubby dearest to catch up on his football matches. The breakfast was served hot , even though they didnt have a restaurant of their own. 

Definitely worth the rate.

title: Modern, Luxurious but lack of Restaurant in the Hotel
text:
Visited this hotel on the month of March, 2016. The hotel is located opposite to Rail station, and was easy to locate. Also you may find the location in the google map which shows the correct location.

The hotel has parking facility and the gate keep/security person was helpful.

Enter the Hotel, and you will realise that its a modern hotel with nice and clean interior.

The receptionist was not very welcoming or I would say the approach was lethargic however not bad in any manner.

Enter the room, its big one, equipped with A\C, And cupboard. There was electric kettle available along with tea bag, coffee, sugar, dairy whitener.

Room was clean, bed was neat, other things were in place properly.

Restroom/Bathroom room was clean, well decorated, running hot water, clean towels, soaps, moisturiser and etc.

They serve packaged drinking water only, no flask available.

The hotel does not have any kitchen, hence plan your lunch or dinner arrangements well ahead of time and you need to goto outside restaurants to fulfil your appetite :-( .The Hotel must start its own kitchen.

Complementary breakfast had lot of options (They must have outsourced it as they do not have kitchen). And food was tasty.

Overall I was happy just because of the cleanliness and modernized interior of the hotel. Also room was really comfortable. But they should make kitchen available in the hotel itself and stuff's approach towards guest should be more welcoming and warming.

title: Amazing...clean...excellent room
text:
So we travelled to Mysore for a break and din wanna spend much money.
My husband checked out the hotel pictures on Google and decided it was worth the money we were paying.
We reached Mysore by bus and it took us just three hours from Bangalore.
Wen we reached it was abt 10.30/am the check in time as per the hotel is 11 am . we requested to check in early as we wanted to visit the chamundi hills temple and were genuinely in a hurry.
But that lady at the reception was so rude and impolite it really put us off and we began to wonder if our choice of the hotel was right.
She wud not allow us to check in and even asked to us to pay 300 bucks etc if we wanted to check in 15mins early. All we wnated to do was put out luggage into the room and go to the temple as it closes at 1pm. Anyways she din allow us to check in. So we left our luggage at the lobby and went off to the temple.
The roads were under construction so wen u get a bus at the bus stop remeber to give the land mark as sayajji road and Santosh hotel. It costs only 25 max 30bucjs don pay more. They ll charge u around 50-60. Ola cab costs 60 bucks.
We went to the city bus stop by auto. It costs u onky 25rs. From there we took a bus directly to chamundi hills. The bus costs only 28rs and it's AC and completely worth it. Cab charges u somewhere between 500-600 bucks.
We then offered our prayers and returned.
I was ald upset abt the hotel and the way that receptionist behaved but however since we had ald booked the room online we decided to check out the room.
Wen we went into the room... It was d complete opp of the lobby downstairs and the receptionist s behavior... It was splendid and fabulous.... A very good amazing clean hotel for a two star rating.
It was brilliant the room. Just perfect and how we imagined it to b...
We were so happy and it was worth every penny. Had good room service and good AC and TV etc.
We stayed two nights and it was worth it completely...we were extremely satisfied with the rooms.
However we were disappointed with the breakfast tat was offered complimentary.. It's not great. Besides that bf area really needs to b done up. It's a put off.
Also there is no kitchen i guess in d hotel so we ordered dinner from nandhini hotel (found it on zomato) the food from there was really yummy.
However over all a good clean and decent budget stay. Def the rooms are over 3star category.
Tip : Don judge the place by the receptionist and the downstairs lobby.
Tip : Make sure u don get cheated by these auto guys.
ownerResponse/text:
Dear Guest,

Thank you so much for sharing your detailed and personal experience. We are extremely glad that you loved your stay with us and enjoyed the trip to the temple. Though we are disappointed about our staff behavior, we would like to bring to your notice that our standard check-in/check-out time is 12 am to 11 am respectively. We are glad we could make your overall stay comfortable. It would be an absolute pleasure to host you again. 

Best Wishes,
Uma Narayan

title: Nice Hotel with less Amenities
text:
Nice Rooms. New hotel, Bath rooms are neatly maintained. Beds and towels are clean and fresh. Bit less-comfort in reaching the hotel because of Road work, once that is completed location would be the main attraction for this hotel. 
Good hotel for those who compromise few Amenities. For those who are keen on the amenities then this is not a hotel for them.
In room we could find the smell of smoking, even though smoking is not allowed in the room. 
1. Amenities:-
------------------ 
a) No Restaurants. 
b)No room service- foods cannot be served to room since they don't have their own restaurant (They can serve only water).
c) No choice of restaurants around that area only few are available.
d) Electric water cattle is provided that is good, Whitener, tea bags, coffee powder sugar has been provided as a complimentary. Which is good.
e) It is said as free Wifi I am not sure where it was.
f)We have to park the car outside. Since there are no vehicular movement due to road construction we can manage to park it on platform.
g) They outsource the complementary break fast. on seeing the four table and ten chairs, we don't want to take risk in having the food in that place so we went out.    
h) windows curtain cannot be kept open, Adjacent locality are not good to see.

2) Service Quality
----------------------
a) we can give 2/5 when your check out time is nearing they will opening the room with their master key and will start cleaning the room, We have to wait out side till they complete the cleaning, and not suppose to use the item that refill (water bottle etc)

text:

Overall it is a very good value for money and a pleasant experience for us.

title: New property has a way to go
text:
The location is good. The roads were under construction. Room was excellent with a some flaws. The bathtub stopper, by the way I really enjoyed, was broken but that didn't stop me from stuffing a towel in the drain.

My biggest dissatisfaction was that my room was not cleaned. I came back in the evening to see that my room wasn't cleaned. I inquired and was told that room aren't cleaned unless requested. It is policy. I asked the manager on duty to please in the future inform guests of this when they checkin. He pointed to a sign that has the policy written but it is on the other end of the counter. Sheets and towels were replaced and a bottle of water was given.

The breakfast and eating area itself needs some help. It appears that this hotel is still being furnished. Hope that is being handled.

The next day during check out I was asked by a day manager if there is anything that could have improved my stay. I shared with him about notifying guests about the room cleaning policy. He began to give me several reasons. I shared with him I am making a suggestion as a business owner to improve your customer service. Please consider. He said in Kannada "This guy doesn't know what he is talking about to another staff person." All the while trying to keep a smile. 

I quickly left the hotel. No need to engage in such behavior. It did leave a sourness to how I exited the hotel. That wan't even necessary. I have mixed feeling about the hotel.

Facility is just new hence they are coming with their restaurant which will start soon as per them. Staff was good and check in check out was smooth. text:

Ma salle de bain est immense aussi, équipée d’une baignoire. 
Seul point négatif : le petit-déjeuner typiquement Inde du Sud n’est malheureusement servi qu’à partir de 8H, voire 8H15, livré dans une pièce inconfortable, dans l'attente de l'ouverture d'un restaurant sur place. 
Une affaire pour le tarif que j'ai payé en réservant par Booking.com (15 euros)

title: Nice new room at a fantastic price
text:
I've given 5 stars based mainly on the excellent value for money that I feel this hotel provides at the price I paid (around 1200 rupees a night). 

The hotel is almost brand new and as stated in previous reviews the shower really is excellent! The AC unit was nice and quiet and the tv had a few english film channels which is always a nice option to have. The wifi was strong. I felt the staff were helpful and always willing to satisfy any requests we had.

If the price was to increase, they would have to improve in a few areas, but at the moment it's a bit of a steal. 

BEWARE - avoid the rickshaw driver that waits out front of the hotel with a sign that says 'Tourist Friendly Auto' on the front of his vehicle. He is just there to rip off tourists. He lies by telling you that he is a 'government recognised guide' and will just try to take you to numerous shops so he can get commission from them. Do yourself a favour - walk up the street 100 yards  and grab another rickshaw. This will save you a lot of time in the long run as you will actually be taken to where you want to go without any hassle!
